title: Website Content Creator and Communications Data Analyst
description:
Job Description
The Systems Engineering Research Center (SERC) seeks an individual with versatile technical and creative skills for a core role on its communications team.
The SERC is a university-affiliated research center (UARC) of the United States Department of Defense (DoD), anchored at Stevens Institute of Technology and including faculty researchers at more than 25 universities nationwide.
Qualifications and Responsibilities* With at least five years of experience, the ideal candidate has the expertise to create and edit pages for the SERC website, elevating the site's visual appeal, information organization, and user experience. Basic graphic design experience is required with programs like Photoshop and Canva. A related task involves uploading reports and updating information on the SERC research database.
* Accuracy is essential for names, titles, technical terms and other details. Many projects require the ability to act quickly.
* This role also calls for an ability to access, organize, analyze and present website data from Google Analytics. The ideal candidate will have a sense of how communication integrates with and evolves through technology and can analyze data to contribute ideas and strategies.
* An exceptional candidate will have experience with building and managing virtual events on Zoom, Teams, and other virtual platforms. Familiarity with government operations, especially the DoD, will also draw interest.
* The SERC team is diverse in numerous ways. The ideal candidate must be comfortable interacting with a mosaic of skill sets, personalities, and backgrounds. Many interactions will be virtual due to the team's national reach. This role is open to the best candidate wherever they live, though being able to commute to the SERC office in Hoboken, NJ, is a plus. This role may require periodic travel for SERC events in the Washington, DC area or to other locales.


How to Apply
To apply, please enclose a resume, a cover letter, and at least three examples of technical and/or creative work accessible online.
Remote candidates are welcome.
Department
Program Operations SERC

title: Medical Assistant Mobile Health Unit/Driver
description:
Company Overview: At Essen Health Care, we care for that! 

 As the largest privately held multispecialty medical group in the Bronx, we provide high-quality, compassionate, and accessible medical care to some of the most vulnerable and under-served residents of New York State. Guided by a Population Health model of care, Essen has five integrated clinical divisions offering urgent care, primary care, and specialty services, as well as nursing home staffing and care management. Founded in 1999, our over 20-year commitment has fueled an unwavering dedication toward innovating a better healthcare delivery system. Essen has expanded from a single primary care office to an umbrella organization offering specialties from women’s health to endocrinology, from psychiatry to a vast array of other specialties. All clinical services are offered via telehealth or in-person at over 35 medical offices and at home through the Essen House Calls program. 

 Essen Health Care is the place Where Care Comes Together! We are looking for the most talented and effective individuals to join our rapidly growing company. With over 1,100 employees and 400+ Practitioners, we care for over 250,000 patients annually in New York City and beyond. From medical providers to administration & operational staff, there is a career here for you. Join our team today!

Position Title: Medical Assistant/ Driver

Job Summary: As a Medical Assistant/ Driver, you are responsible for assisting the physician with basic patient care and medical procedures. The MA Driver will perform patient services as requested which may include but is not limited to driving, parking, and managing the front cabin of the van.

Responsibilities include:

· Greets and registers patients.

· Driving, parking, and managing the front cabin of the van.

· Fulfills clerical responsibilities, including insurance eligibility, obtain diagnostic reports, patient demographics, ensures all incoming/outgoing referrals are booked and addressed accordingly

· Answers phones, responds to inquiries and triage calls to appropriate personnel.

· Checks on all incoming faxes and distributes accordingly.

· Makes courtesy calls and appointment confirmations for office/Urgent Care patients.

· Reschedule no show appointments. Inputs patient data into EMR system.

· Fulfills patient care responsibilities, including taking vital signs, updating patient HX, collecting blood, urine, and stool specimens, and assisting providers/nurses in the exam room.

· Responsible for learning use of all current and future equipment’s used for patient assessment and diagnosing.

· Checks date on materials and medications for expiration dates and discards expired items. Complete weekly and monthly inventory for all supplies, medical and office.

Qualifications:

· High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or less than one year related experience or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience

· Must have an active drivers license in good standing

· Three months experience in clinical setting

· One year education in medical field

· Knowledge of medical terminology

· Knowledge of Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, and internet software Specialized Training:

· CPR

· HIPAA

· OSHA

· MA Certificate

· CLIA Training

title: Paralegal
description:
**PARALEGAL**

**Company Overview:**

Our legal team at NLLG are partnered with a reputable and growing debt restructuring company dedicated to providing financial solutions and relief to individuals burdened by debt. Together, we assist clients in achieving debt freedom and financial stability through strategic debt management plans. We are seeking a skilled and dedicated Paralegal to join our dynamic team in Wall Township NJ and play a key role in helping our clients regain control of their financial future.

**Job Summary:**

As a Paralegal at our debt restructuring company, you will be an integral part of our legal team, providing essential support to attorneys and clients throughout the debt restructuring process. Your primary responsibilities will involve conducting legal research, preparing legal documents, and facilitating communication between clients, attorneys, and creditors. The successful candidate will be detail-oriented, possess strong organizational skills, and have a genuine passion for helping others overcome financial challenges.

**Responsibilities:**

· Conduct thorough legal research and analysis on debt restructuring laws, regulations, and best practices.

· Prepare legal documents, including debt restructuring agreements, contracts, and settlement proposals.

· Assist attorneys in drafting legal correspondence and pleadings related to debt consolidation cases.

· Communicate and liaise with clients, creditors, and legal partners to ensure smooth case progression and timely resolution.

· Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of client interactions and case details in our database.

· Monitor and track the status of debt restructuring cases and keep all stakeholders informed of developments.

· Provide exceptional customer service to clients by addressing inquiries and concerns promptly and professionally.

· Stay informed about industry trends, changes in debt restructuring laws, and updates on creditor practices.

· Collaborate with the legal team to improve internal processes and enhance overall efficiency.

**Qualifications:**

· Associate degree in Paralegal Studies or related field; Bachelor's degree is a plus

· Paralegal certificate

· Proven experience as a Paralegal in debt restructuring or related legal field

· Knowledge of debt restructuring laws, consumer finance regulations, and creditor practices

· Excellent research, writing, and communication skills

· Proficiency in legal research tools and database management

· Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously

· Empathetic and professional demeanor with the ability to handle sensitive client matters

· Team player with a commitment to achieving collective goals

**Benefits:**

· Health insurance for employees, mostly covered by the firm

· Health savings account available

· Paid time off and holidays

· 401K – 3% contribution by the firm, fully vested after 2 years

· Professional development opportunities

· Positive and collaborative work environment

This position offers a competitive salary along with opportunities for professional growth and development within the legal field. If you are a detail-oriented individual with a passion for law, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity as a Paralegal. Join our team today and be part of a company that makes a meaningful impact on people's lives!

To apply, submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and interest in this position. We look forward to reviewing your application.

*Note: This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the responsibilities and qualifications required for the role of Paralegal at our debt restructuring company. Actual job responsibilities and qualifications may vary depending on the specific needs of the company.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* No nights
* No weekends

Experience:

* Paralegal: 2 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Wall Township, NJ (Required)

Work Location: In person

description:
This is a Hybrid job Front Desk/Sales coordinator

We are located in Long Island, the best transportation to the hotel is by car.

**UNFORTUNATELY WE DO NOT OFFER BENEFITS. WE ARE LOCATED IN LONG ISLAND NY, YOU NEED A RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION**

If you are ready to be a part of a fun environment where team work and chemistry are key, then you are welcome to apply!

**Front Desk Agent job description**

* Perform all check-in and check-out tasks
* Manage online and phone reservations
* Inform customers about payment methods and verify their credit card data
* Register guests collecting necessary information (like contact details and exact dates of their stay)
* Welcome guests upon their arrival and assign rooms
* Provide information about our hotel, available rooms, rates and amenities
* Respond to clients’ complaints in a timely and professional manner

\\*

**Sales Coordinator Essential Responsibilities:**

* Provides professional and courteous guest service at all times.
* Confirm group reservations and arrange personalized services for VIP customers and event attendees, like wedding guests, sport groups etc.
* Be available on evenings, weekends and holidays.
* Answers/forwards client requests, complaints or questions in a courteous timely manner.
* Covers Front Desk shifts during periods of absence.
* Move throughout property to conduct site inspections. Assist to selling all facets of the hotel, both orally and in written form to previous, current and potential clients.
* Develop and maintain exceptional relationships with specified accounts to create trust, loyalty and lasting business relationships.
* Conduct direct sales solicitation through phone calls and email
* Answer to any inquires, guest reviews in a courteous timely manner.

communication.

* Establish priorities set by the General Manager for effective time management to focus on revenue generating activities.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $17.00 - $19.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee discount

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Holidays
* Night shift
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* What Property Management System (PMS) are you familiar with?

Experience:

* Hotel: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Roslyn, NY 11576: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Corporate Finance/M&A - Vice President
description:
Capital Markets & Advisory | Corporate Finance M&A | Vice President M&A |New York
About ING:*Ranked #8 on LinkedIn Top Companies in Financial Services**Crain’s 100 Best Places to Work**Ragan’s Top Places to Work in 2023*
In Americas, ING’s Wholesale Banking division offers a broad range of innovative financial products and services to domestic and international corporate and institutional clients.  

  

When you come to work at ING, you’re joining a team where individuality isn’t just accepted, it’s encouraged. We’ve built a culture that’s fun, friendly and supportive – it’s the kind of place where you can be yourself and make the most of whatever you have to offer.  

  

We give people the freedom to take risks, think differently, take ownership of their work, and make great things happen. We’re here to help you get ahead. And with our global network, there’s plenty of scope to take your career in new directions, perhaps even ones you’ve never considered. ING Americas follows a hybrid work model, allowing for in-office / work from home flexibility. Hybrid work arrangements vary based on business area.  

Sound like the kind of place you’d feel at home? We’d love to hear from you.
About the position:
The Vice President is primarily involved in supporting the origination and execution of M&A and strategic advisory transactions within the Corporate Finance (“CF”) / M&A team
Title: Vice President
Department: Corporate Finance/M&A, part of Capital Markets & Advisory
Line Manager: Head of Corporate Finance, Americas
Location: New York
About the department:
ING Corporate Finance advises on M&A transactions, including buy side and sell side deals, strategic advisory assignments and capital raisings. The team supports the ING client base across many sectors, with a focus on transportation and infrastructure, food and agriculture, energy, telecom, media and technology (TMT). Corporate Finance is a growing M&A platform in New York that is part of a dynamic global team that also operates out of ING’s offices in London, Amsterdam, Madrid, Brussels, Frankfurt, Manila, Hong Kong and Singapore.
The Vice President Corporate Finance / M&A role offers a mix of hands-on M&A transaction experience across industries and deal size ranges. You will work with other team members globally in the analysis, financial modelling, negotiation, sourcing, and managing of M&A transactions on behalf on ING’s clients, both financial sponsors and corporates. ING is seeking candidates that have experience and are keen to progress their careers in the investment banking industry in a growing M&A platform.
Responsibilities :* Working within the Corporate Finance M&A team in New York with a focus on originating and executing M&A deals, strategic advisory assignments and capital raising transactions
* Assisting senior team members and managing junior staff in the origination and execution of transactions, supporting and supervising the preparation of presentations, comprehensive (financial) analyses and daily project management including frequent contact with current and prospective clients and external advisers (e.g. M&A bankers, lawyers, accountants, consultants, financing bankers)
* Monitoring market developments, identifying opportunities for new business and building a client network
* Maintaining close ties with the relevant product and sector teams within ING, including Sector Coverage, Acquisition Finance, Corporate Investments, Loan Capital Markets, Debt Capital Markets, Equity Capital Markets and Sustainable Finance teams


Qualifications and Competencies
Vice Presidents have 6 to 9 years of working experience within M&A at a reputable investment bank. Suitable candidates have demonstrable hands-on experience in M&A on a daily basis, have a high energy level, strong commercial drive, attention to detail, ability to work time-efficiently within a team setting and are able to represent the team well, both internally and externally.* Knowledge of M&A processes
* Financial modelling
* Problem analysis and judgment
* Ambition and high level of energy
* High attention to detail and accuracy
* Teamwork
* Strong communication skills
* Performance motivation
* Perseverance
* Creativity and idea generation
* Client origination drive
* Ambition to mentor and train junior team members
* Fluency in business English is required

*Base Salary Range $230K - $270K**In addition to comprehensive health benefits, a generous 401k savings plan, and competitive PTO, ING provides a broad array of benefits including adoption, surrogacy, and fertility services; student debt assistance; and subsidies for expenses associated with working from home, commuting, and fitness.**ING is a committed equal opportunity employer. We welcome applicants of diverse backgrounds and hire without regard to color, gender, religion, national origin, citizenship, disability, age, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law. We celebrate these differences and rely upon your unique perspective to innovate and seize new opportunities. Come as you are.**ING Bank does not have a commercial banking license in the U.S. and therefore not permitted to conduct a commercial banking business in the U.S. Through its wholly owned subsidiary ING Financial Services LLC, and its affiliates, it offers a full array of wholesale products such as commercial lending and a full range of FM products and services.*
company_description: With 9 million account holders, ING is one of the largest and most prominent financial service providers in the Netherlands. We are part of ING Group, a global financial institution.
ceo_name: Steven van Rijswijk, CEO ING Group

title: Weekend Producer
description:
OVERVIEW OF THE COMPANY
Fox News Media
FOX News Media operates the FOX News Channel (FNC), FOX Business Network (FBN), FOX News Digital, FOX News Audio, FOX News Books, the direct-to-consumer digital streaming services FOX Nation and FOX News International and the newly announced platform FOX Weather. Currently the number one network in all of cable, FNC has also been the most watched television news channel for 20 consecutive years, while FBN currently ranks among the top business channels on cable. Owned by FOX Corporation, FOX News Media reaches 200 million people each month.
JOB DESCRIPTION
Fox News seeks a Weekend Producer with extensive experience writing and producing news for television. The Weekend Producer will work on top-rated daytime news programs 5 days a week, including Fox News Live on Saturdays and Sundays. As Weekend Producer, you will be responsible for line producing competitive news hours and overseeing a team of writers, APs, and PAs. You will work with reporters, assignment desk personnel, and senior management daily.
The Weekend Producer will put together fresh, fast-moving, and compelling hours in the Fox News newsroom and take the broadcasts on and off the air in the control room. Additionally, the Weekend Producer must write with urgency, style, and brevity while delivering substantial news in a highly-produced environment.
A SNAPSHOT OF YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES* Line produce top rated newscasts on weekends as well as weekdays
* Work in a fast-paced environment, multitask, and prioritize on a daily basis, especially in breaking news situations
* Work with an experienced Senior Producer on the vision, layout, and execution of each show
* Work with a team of writers and APs to craft each show
* Generate original content ideas, as well as write and copy edit scripts
* Produce segments, live shots, packages, and graphics
* Manage the production of live segments, coordinating efforts within our bureau and on-location


WHAT YOU WILL NEED* A Bachelor’s Degree in journalism or a related field of study preferred, or equivalent experience
* 5+ years of experience writing and line producing broadcast news in a working control room
* Exceptional editorial judgment
* Strong communication and polished writing skills
* Strong knowledge of and passion for national politics and current news
* Digital tape and graphic experience
* Ability to work well in a fast-paced and intense atmosphere
* Familiarity with iNews, VIZ, and an understanding of building program rundowns
* Flexibility to work various shifts when needed, and a willingness to travel when necessary
* Ability to be a self-starter with a self-motivated nature
* Ability to work independently and with a team


#LI-DNI*We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable law.**At FOX, we foster a culture and environment where everyone feels welcome and can thrive. We are deeply committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, including attracting, retaining, and promoting diverse talent across our company. We live in a diverse world, with different ideas and different perspectives that come together to spark new ideas and make great things happen. That means reflecting the diversity of the world around us is critical to our company’s success. We ensure that our viewers, communities and employees feel heard, represented, and celebrated both on screen and off.*  


Pursuant to state and local pay disclosure requirements, the pay range for this role, with final offer amount dependent on education, skills, experience, and location is: $84,500.00-116,000.00 annually for New York City and Westchester County, NY. This role is also eligible for various benefits, including medical/dental/vision, insurance, a 401(k) plan, paid time off, and other benefits in accordance with applicable plan documents. Benefits for Union represented employees will be in accordance with the applicable collective bargaining agreement.
View more detail about FOX Benefits.
company_addresses:
1211 Avenue of the Americas
New York, NY 10036

title: Client Care Manager
description:
Comfort Keepers is now hiring an outgoing, excited candidate for the position of Client Care Manager in our Robbinsville, NJ location.

Comfort Keepers provides in-home care services to seniors in the Central New Jersey area, including companionship, personal care, private duty nursing and live-in care. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a growing industry.

Job Description:

* The Client Care Manager is responsible to achieve revenue objectives for an assigned territory by growing the business and managing operations to ensure quality service delivery.
* Must be capable of working with clients from the time of initial inquiry through ongoing customer service issues.
* Will manage relations with clients, schedulers, and caregivers to provide outstanding in-home care.

Requirements:

* The ideal candidate will have a creative business mind with proven problem solving skills.
* The fast-paced working environment requires a driven person who can multi-task under pressure and meet deadlines while maintaining a calm and courteous demeanor.
* Compassionate people skills are a must.
* Attention to detail as well as seeing the big picture.
* Proficient computer skills (Office, Excel, Power Point, Google Docs), including ability to learn and maintain records in company software systems.
* Ability to work flexible hours required, some evenings and weekends.
* Bachelor's degree required.

Here is what we have to offer:

* Competitive Salary
* Medical/ Vision/ Dental
* Matching 401K
* Paid Time Off

title: Field Service Technician
description:
Our client is a global, mission-driven health tech company with revenues exceeding $200 million, employing over 600 professionals worldwide. The Field Services Organization is expanding and they are actively seeking a Field Service Engineer to join their team and support customers within the New York City & CT region.

In this role, you will play a pivotal part in providing field service support, installing, troubleshooting, repairing, conducting preventive maintenance, and training customers in the use and care of their medical device systems.

**SALARY & BENEFITS**

Highly competitive compensation and benefits package:

* **Base is within the $60,000 - $62,000 range**. The position is non-exempt and eligible for overtime pay. Average total income is between $80,000-$90,000.
* Medical, Dental, Vision, FSA, Life Insurance, Short/Long Term Disability, 401K.
* Company vehicle.

**Responsibilities:**

* Plan installation of new customer sites by liaising with in-house field support team and conducting a pre-installation conference call with the customer.
* Provide optimum customer satisfaction on all products and services.
* Install, repair, perform preventive maintenance, and retrofit instrument products.
* Support customers on the operational aspects of the instrument, equipment and software.
* Install and maintain wired computer networks.
* Complete and submit all Regulatory and company required documentation.
* Provide remote diagnosis/repair support when needed.
* Relay field repetitive failures/quality issues to internal support specialists.
* Ensure that all repair parts are on site when needed and all related CRM transactions are completed thoroughly and in a timely manner.
* Test repaired instruments in all operating modes per specification.
* Represent the company at technical shows and exhibitions as required

**Qualifications:** 

* Technician experience in electronics, biomedical equipment, laser and optical engineering, or similar OR military technical training
* Associates, Bachelor’s, CBET Certification or BMET Training a plus.
* Basic wired and wireless network integration experience
* Skilled in instrument operation, test, maintenance, alignment, and repair procedure
* Ability to produce high quality work under pressure and within tight timescales
* Strong team player with flexible attitude to work priorities
* Exceptional customer service skills with excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.

**PHYSICAL/TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS**

* Valid driver's license
* Up to 70% travel (Domestic travel and overnight trips which may last several days)
* Ability to lift/lower/carry/push/pull 1-50 lbs frequently and 50-100 lbs occasionally
* Manual dexterity of arms, hands, and shoulders to push/pull/grasp equipment/tools.
* Ability to work in tight spaces

Field Service Engineer, Military, Avionics Electronics Technician, Calibration Technician, Biomedical Technician, Electronics Technician, Fire Control Electronics Technician, Electronics Engineering, Electronics repair, electronics troubleshooting, Navy, Army, Marines, Air Force, Preventative Maintenance, Optics, Laser, Imaging,

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $95,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Overtime

Application Question(s):

* Describe your electronics troubleshooting, repair experience.
* Compensation is paid hourly and base is $60,000 - $62,000. With overtime pay and participation in the Field Service Incentive plan, the average total income is $80-90K.

* Driver's License (Required)

title: Fashion Institute of Technology Campus Skincare Ambassador- Silver Mirror Facial Bar
description:
**About Us:** Silver Mirror offers a customized facial for every face. As the original facial bar founded in 2016, we have been changing the skincare game since its inception. We deliver results-driven, highly specialized facial treatments tailored to fit any schedule and cater to every face. Every Silver Mirror service combines cutting-edge technologies, premium products, and world-class estheticians to enhance and sustain your skin’s health.

**Job Description:** We are seeking an enthusiastic and motivated student to join our team as College Campus Ambassadors. As an ambassador, you will represent Silver Mirror on your college campus, and help increase brand awareness, engagement and bring new customers to Silver Mirror (NYC/DC / Miami locations). This is a part-time, flexible position that will allow you to learn about the skincare and spa business, gain valuable marketing experience, have the opportunity to pitch your creative ideas , develop your leadership skills and gain valuable experience all with a flexible schedule that you set.

**Pay and Perks**

* $10 commission for ever completed appointment
* $35 commission for every 30-minute membership sold and $60 for every 50-minute membership sold (Solidcore’s strategy)
* $500 for every 50 sign-ups, $1,000 for every 75 sign-ups
* Free monthly facials
* Free products to keep your skin looking its best
* Silver Mirror skincare product box every semester
* Branded merchandise including silk pillowcase and eye mask
* Throw sponsored events and parties on and off campus and engage with different groups and clubs on campus i.e. sororities and athletes

**Responsibilities:**

* Promote Silver Mirror through various channels including social media, events, and peer-to-peer interactions with the goal of having peers come into Silver Mirror for monthly facials
* Organize and host events and activities to raise awareness about Silver Mirror and our services
* Each month, plan 1 event to be held on campus and 1 to be held at Silver Mirror (Solidcore’s strategy)
* Distribute promotional materials and provide feedback on marketing strategies and materials
* Engage with students to create a positive and inclusive brand presence on campus
* Collaborate with company representatives to implement marketing campaigns
* Collect and report feedback from students about their experiences and suggestions for improvement

**We provide:** 

* Product samples to give out to peers
* Promotional materials
* Materials and products for sponsored events and parties

**Requirements:**

* Currently enrolled as a student at (College Name)
* Passionate about skincare, Silver Mirror and our mission
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability speak publicly and engage people on a regular basis
* Active on social media with a good following - over 5,000 followers
* Ability to create ongoing content around Silver Mirror
* Creative, proactive, and able to work independently
* Prior experience in marketing, event planning, or leadership roles is a plus
* Sorority involvement is a plus

**How to Apply:** Interested candidates should submit their resume and a brief explanation of why they would be a great fit for this role.

Job Types: Contract, Internship

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

Location:

* Manhattan, NY 10001 (Required)

Work Location: Remote
company_description: Silver Mirror is a facial bar offering highly-specialized, results-driven facials meant to fit into your lifestyle and routine.

title: Commercial & Residential Door Technician
description:
**About Us:**  
Alpha Locksmith & Security, based in Hoboken, New Jersey, specializes in locksmith and door services for both residential and commercial clients across NJ and NYC. We’re a trusted name in door repair, installation, and security solutions, serving New York and New Jersey with dedication and excellence.

**We’re Hiring:**  
We are seeking an experienced **Commercial & Residential Door Technician** to join our growing team. If you have the skills and experience, we want to hear from you!

**Responsibilities:**

* Install, repair, and maintain commercial and residential doors and related hardware.
* Work on fire door frames, doors, locksets, exit devices, closers, and other door hardware to ensure proper functionality.
* Install push bars, door closers, hinges, and other essential door hardware.
* Maintain accurate service records and manage inventory effectively.
* Assist with additional tasks as needed to support our team.
* **Be punctual and reliable, with the ability to communicate clearly and effectively.**

**Experience Required:**

* Minimum of 5 years of experience as a door technician.
* Strong mechanical skills and proficiency with tools and equipment.
* Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks efficiently.

title: School Nurse
description:
Working collaboratively with health care providers, students parents, school district staff and community agencies to ensure access and continuity of care for students  
Assisting in the establishment and maintenance of a comprehensive school health program  
Collecting information about the health development status of students for compliance with state immunization regulations and Board of Education policies  
Conducting school programs of immunization, physical examinations, and sight and hearing testing  
Performing nursing assessment for students who are ill or injured  
Applying appropriate theory as basis for providing first aid, nursing care, intervention and referrals for those students  
Implementing Board policy with respect to the exclusion and readmission of students in connection with certain infectious and contagious diseases  
Maintaining accurate records and documentation in accordance with state and federal law, and Board of Education policies  
Developing individual health care plan (ICHP) when needed with specific goals, nursing diagnosis, and interventions delineating school-nursing actions unique to students’ needs and for incorporation into the student’s individualized educational plan (IEP)  
Intervening as guided by the nursing care plan to implement nursing actions that promote, maintain or restore health, prevent illness and effect rehabilitation  
Serving as a member of school teams as designated health care professional  
Providing guidance, counseling and health education to students, parents and employees as necessary  
Reporting to parents, school district personnel, physicians, clinics, and others as needed to meet student health needs  
Providing health education to students as requested  
Notifying the appropriate person or agency of student’s injury/illness in accordance with Board policy as necessary  
Conferring with parents, students and school district staff and professionals to interpret health and developmental assessments

Qualifications:  
Bachelor’s degree  
Must meet qualifications of a school nurse as defined in state regulations  
Successful experiences working with pediatric population, preferably in a community or school setting  
Registered professional nurse, designated as RN as defined and determined by state law, and currently licensed in the state  
Current certification in Cardio-Pulmonary Resuscitation (CPR)

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $40.00 - $50.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

License/Certification:

* BLS Certification (Preferred)
* LPN (Preferred)
* RN (Preferred)

title: Supervisor, Production
description:
**Job Description**

**Date**6/2024  

**Location**1300 Airport Road, North Brunswick NJ  

  

**Title**Supervisor, Production  

**Department**Manufacturing  

  

**Reports to**Manager, Production  

**FLSA (Exempt or Non-Exempt**Non-Exempt  

  

**Role Overview**

  

The Production Supervisor oversees the safe and efficient utilization of personnel, time, and materials to meet production schedules. Key elements of success include ensuring safety, sanitation, housekeeping, GMP standards, problem-solving skills, and fostering positive employee relations. This role involves planning, coordinating, and managing all production activities for floor employees. The Production Supervisor must also collaborate with other departments to maintain schedules and implement necessary changes and revisions.  



  

**Areas of Responsibility**

  

**Production**

* **Ensure Schedule Adherence:** Distribute workload based on changing priorities to meet production schedules.
* **Regulatory Compliance:** Maintain control over production operations to meet regulatory requirements by ensuring the accuracy of batch documentation, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), and other critical documentation. Ensure equipment is well-maintained and calibrated, training is up-to-date, and high standards of housekeeping are maintained.
* **Equipment Maintenance:** Coordinate preventative maintenance and repairs and evaluate new equipment and techniques to ensure operational efficiency.
* **Problem Solving:** Evaluate and resolve production issues by reviewing areas of concern, developing and testing potential solutions, and preparing recommendations for management.
* **Foster Teamwork:** Maintain a work environment that supports teamwork and continuous process improvement.
* **Reporting and Inventory:** Prepare production reports, variance explanations, and accurately compile and file inventories. Order production supplies as needed.
* **Interdepartmental Interaction:** Collaborate with multiple functions and shifts within the 24/7 operation.
* **Preventative Maintenance Coordination:** Work closely with maintenance to establish preventative maintenance practices.

**Quality**

* **Deviation Investigations:** Participate in investigations for deviations involving batch records.
* **GMP Compliance:** Maintain proper gowning and hygiene to ensure product integrity according to cGMPs and company policies.
* **Procedure Adherence:** Follow batch records, SOPs, and cGMP guidelines to meet product specifications and tolerances.
* **Policy and Procedure Compliance:** Ensure full compliance with company policies, procedures, GMPs, Ethical Business Practices, and SOPs at all times.
* **Documentation:** Ensure operation logs, batch records, and other documentation are fully completed, signed, and comply with company standards and regulatory requirements.
* **Quality Standards:** Ensure products meet applicable quality standards, including inspection for quality during operations and performing required sampling and testing.

**People**

* **Foster Collaboration:** Create an environment that respects and values diverse backgrounds.
* **Effective Communication:** Establish and maintain effective relationships with peers, team members, and senior managers to ensure clear communication.
* **Provide Direction:** Set clear directions and expectations for direct reports, ensuring tasks and responsibilities are understood.
* **Goal Setting:** Align goals and objectives with the organization for self and direct reports, create action plans, set milestones, and deliver progress reports and development plans for team members.
* **Employee Development:** Develop employees to contribute to daily line success and prepare them for supervisory roles.
* **Communication:** Maintain open lines of communication with employees, peers, and management.
* **Production Efficiency:** Ensure efficient, timely, and accurate completion of production functions.
* **Cross-functional Support:** Learn and understand specific manufacturing operations to provide support in other areas as needed.
* **Performance Evaluation:** Evaluate employee performance and create corrective action plans where appropriate.
* **Personnel Decisions:** Assist with hiring, terminations, attendance management, wage decisions, transfers, and promotions.
* **Policy Interpretation:** Explain company policies to employees to ensure understanding and application and apply policies fairly and consistently.
* **Identify Strengths and Weaknesses:** Assess team members to ensure optimal performance and assign tasks accordingly.

**Other Responsibilities Including Safety**

* **Safety and Responsibility:** Work safely and responsibly to create an injury-free and incident-free workplace.
* **Training Compliance:** Comply with all job-related safety and other training requirements.
* Communication with Management: Keep management informed of area activities and significant problems.
* **Extended Hours:** Work extended hours and occasional weekend overtime as required.
* **Other Duties** : Perform other duties as assigned.
  

**Requirements**

  

**Education & Qualification:**

* **Degree Requirement** : BA/BS degree with 3+ years of supervisory experience.
* **Industry Experience** : Minimum of three (3) years of work experience in nutritionals, supplements, food, or pharmaceutical manufacturing industries.
* **Process Knowledge** : Hands-on experience with any of the following processes:

* Blending/Granulation
* Tablet Compression and/or Film Coating
* Encapsulation
* Pharmacy/Pre-Weigh Dispensing
**Certifications, Licenses, Credentials:**

* None Required
**Skills & Ability**

* **Teamwork** : Demonstrates ability to work collaboratively and assist others.
* **Precision** : Able to follow written instructions precisely and perform basic math calculations as required.
* **Regulatory Knowledge** : Understands and is knowledgeable of cGMP, OSHA standards, etc.
* **Mechanical Aptitude** : Mechanically inclined to understand the inner workings of equipment.
* **Process Knowledge** : Knowledge of processes including Blending/Granulation, Tablet Compression and/or Film Coating, Encapsulation, Packaging, or Pharmacy/Pre-Weigh Dispensing.

* **Language Proficiency** : Demonstrates the ability to read and write English to understand industry-regulated instruction sheets.
**Physical Requirements**

* **Lifting** : Ability to lift up to 50 lbs. and occasionally lift and move up to 75 pounds.
* **Mobility** : Must stand and walk on the production floor for a minimum of 6 hours per shift.
* **Manual Dexterity** : Uses hands to finger, handle, feel, or operate objects or controls, lifting to waist height and/or above shoulder height, frequent bending from the waist, squatting, and walking short distances.
* **Flexibility** : Occasionally works from a rolling ladder or step stool, able to lean over equipment, and kneel on the floor to clean under the equipment.
* **Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)** : Must be able to wear all PPE including a lab coat, face mask, booties, gloves, safety glasses/goggles, and respirators.
**Work Environment**

* **Manufacturing Setting** : Work is regularly performed inside a manufacturing environment where temperatures can be moderate. Exposure to dust, odors, noise, and fumes is common. The noise level is usually moderate.
* **Chemical Exposure** : Employees can be exposed daily to chemicals and cleaning agents.
  

*The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being* *performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all the job responsibilities, duties, skill, or working conditions. In addition, this document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an "at will" relationship.*

title: COCINERO DE RESTAURANTE
description:
**COCINERO DE RESTAURANTE**  

* Ubicación: Rockville Centre Long Island **NY - Nueva York**
* Tipo de trabajo: **Tiempo completo , Medio tiempo**
* Pago: **$17-$19 por hora (Basado en experiencia)**

  

**Ahora estamos contratando para el puesto de cocinero**  

**Aplica en línea hoy**  

Buscamos un cocinero con experiencia y que disfrute su trabajo para unirse a nuestro equipo. El candidato ideal para este puesto debe tener experiencia previa en la preparación de deliciosas hamburguesas y otra clase de comidas, disfruta trabajando en un ambiente de restaurante con bastante movimiento y es capaz de seguir instrucciones y de realizar múltiples acciones al mismo tiempo efectivamente. Si tiene experiencia en la industria de restaurantes y le apasiona la buena comida, envíenos una solicitud hoy mismo.  

* Parrilla
* Freidora
* Acabado

**Responsabilidades del cocinero**  

Estarás entrenando en todas las estaciones de la cocina.  

**Las responsabilidades de un miembro de BOH incluyen:**  

* Medir y mezclar los ingredientes para preparar algunos ingredientes del menu siguiendo las recetas.
* Colaborar con el jefe de la cocina y los cocineros para preparar comidas durante nuestro horario de comedor.
* Mantener inventarios de alimentos precisos.
* Almacenar adecuadamente los alimentos a las temperaturas adecuadas.
* Rotar los artículos de stock según los procedimientos establecidos (FIFO).
* Reabastecer las estaciones para los turnos posteriores.
* Asegurarse de que el área de preparación de alimentos y la cocina estén limpios y desinfectados durante y al final de su turno

**Cualificaciones laborales**  

* Preferiblemente 2 años o más de experiencia como cocinero.
* Capaz de leer tickets en inglés y seguir recetas y protocolos.
* Gran conocimiento de los procedimientos adecuados de manipulación de alimentos.
* Capaz de trabajar en equipo en un ambiente de cocina con bastante movimiento.

title: Direct Support Professional (DSP)
description:
**Overview**
============



Developmental Disabilities Institute, DDI, is one of the largest providers of care to children and adults with Autism, developmental disabilities and other special needs. DDI has been a part of Long Island for over 50 years serving over 1,500 children and adults with Autism, other developmental disabilities and special needs. DDI provides innovative and expansive services to our population through various educational settings, residential services, day habilitation programs and vocational services.


**Salary: $17.85 - $21.42/hour**


**Shifts Available: Wednesday 11P-7A, Thursday 11A-7A, Friday 10P-10A, and Saturday 10P-10A.**


**Responsibilities**
====================


* Complete all required trainings, and participate in Peer Mentoring Program, in-service workshops, and recertification trainings as required.
* Become certified and maintain certifications in SCIP-R, First Aid and CPR
* Must have a Valid NYS Driver’s license and be able to obtain DDI approved driver status.
* Participate in semi-annual IDT, quarterly, staff meetings, and staffing as required.
* Advocate for the rights of the individual(s) we serve.
* Help individual(s) build relationships, and maintain relationships with family and friends.
* Follow individual(s) daily activity/classroom schedule, implementing all formal goals and protocols of individuals you are assigned to.
* Data collection – goals, protocols, outings, SUB’s, progress notes, recreation/fitness logs.
* Obtain and maintain certification for, and administer medications under the supervision of assigned nursing staff (AMAP), if applicable. (Level 3 and 2 if applicable)
* Must have a Valid NYS Driver’s license and be able to obtain DDI approved driver status. (Level 3 and 2 if applicable)
* Fulfill responsibilities of primary advocate (paperwork, advocacy, programming).
* Instruction and documentation, participation in development and revisions of formal goals and protocols in accordance with the CFA/ISP, and behavior plans.
* Teach and assist individuals in all aspects of daily living, including, but not limited to: ADL’s, cooking, house cleaning, laundry, leading a healthy lifestyle, shopping, budgeting, maintaining appropriate behavior, and community integration.
* Accompany individuals on medical appointments, jobs, and community activities, if applicable.
* Complete incident reports and SCIP-R reports as necessary.
* Knowledge and accurate implementation of Emergency Procedures.
* Demonstrated knowledge of all OPWDD and DDI policy and procedures as they pertain to individuals supported, and documentation of such.
* Ensure the vans are clean and vehicle problems are written down and addressed through the Site Supervisor/Manager.

**Qualifications**
==================


* Ability to read, understand, and follow safety guidelines

We are committed to creating a deep sense of belonging and a culture where all applicants and employees feel welcomed, valued and respected. We are people inspired by purpose.*

title: Direct Support Professional - Westchester Day Hab
description:
**Job Summary**

The Direct Support Professional (DSP) is responsible for supporting persons receiving services while promoting their personal, physical and emotional wellbeing. The primary role of the Direct Support Professional is to work alongside the people we support in order to help them to achieve their personal goals. The DSP ensures the delivery of Habilitation services, service plans or other OPWDD supports and documents and verifies daily data collection.

**About Abbott House**

Abbott House is an innovative community-based organization that helps children, families, adults, and people with intellectual and developmental disabilities with complex needs build lasting foundations for a promising future. We operate programs in the New York Metropolitan area and Hudson Valley.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Adheres to all regulations, policies, procedures and protocols set forth by NY OPWDD, NY Justice Center, Centers for Medicare/Medicaid and Abbott House.
* Establishes a positive working relationship with the individual, family and direct supervisor
* Maintains a professional demeanor when interacting with parents, guardians and other professionals.
* Expected to learn, and demonstrate skills outlined in the DSP Code of Ethics and DSP Core Competencies.
* Service can only be provided Monday through Friday between 9am and 3pm and only in the Community.
* To provide meaningful services to the individual out in the community. These services are about the individual and their choices.
* Implements outlined Habilitation and Behavioral Support plans/programs and documents accordingly. Maintain documentation for each service provided by completing a daily note, documenting the service on the Individual response sheet and completing a monthly summary
* Provide transportation to and from community outings. Candidate will need to use their own car and will be reimbursed for mileage
* Submit completed paperwork by the 3rd business day of the new month
* Attend individual’s Life Plan reviews to share the progress and any issues or concerns
* To keep lines of communication opened between Supervisor, House Manager, Care Coordinators and Families (if applicable)

**About You**

You are the ideal candidate if you are passionate about the social services field and empowering underserved communities. Being compassionate, organized, self-motivated, driven, flexible and responsive are critical attributes to be successful in this role.

* You have a High school diploma or GED
* You have a valid driver’s license
* Communicate effectively orally and in writing.
* One year experience working with people with developmental disabilities preferred.

title: Echo Tech
description:
**Job Summary:**

We are seeking a skilled Echo Technician/Sonographer to join our team. The ideal candidate will perform diagnostic ultrasound examinations for patients under the supervision of physicians. This role requires proficiency in operating ultrasound equipment to capture images and conduct examinations related to cardiac anatomy and function.

**Responsibilities:**

* Perform echocardiogram procedures and vascular ultrasound examinations as prescribed by physicians.

title: Health Fitness Professional
description:
HealthFitness, a Trustmark company, is a proven leader in providing fitness solutions that engage and connect people both on-site and online, to create a strong community of health. Our work focuses on creating meaningful connections with each of our participants to help them move forward. We foster each individual’s journey by creating communities of health within the organizations we serve – so that everyone is supported. As an employee of HealthFitness you will enjoy a variety of health and financial benefits and receive competitive pay. We provide personal and professional support, training and development and flexible employment opportunities.
HealthFitness is looking for a Health Fitness Professional to join the team at our large client site located in East Hanover, NJ. In this role, you will make a direct impact on the health and well-being of our members through the coordination, implementation, and delivery of health and fitness improvement programs and services, fitness center promotions and outreach activities. You will provide individual and group exercise instruction, monitor fitness facility and conduct fitness testing and assessments, advising participants of the results and designing individualized programs to meet the members’ interests, abilities and goals. Other duties as-needed/assigned. The site location has two fitness centers on campus and outdoor sports and recreation space.  

  

Schedule: Rotating shifts of four days/10 hour shifts and five days at 8 hour shifts, AM and PM hours
What you'll bring with you:* Bachelor's degree or higher in a related field (Kinesiology, Exercise Science, etc.) or the equivalent combination of education, industry experience and current certification(s) from a HealthFitness approved provider.
* Current Adult First Aid and CPR/AED certifications from American Heart Association or American Red Cross. (Note: certification must have an in-person component and not 100% online/OSHA complaint)
* Industry recognized Group Exercise certification from ACE, AFAA/NASM, ACSM, NCCPT or NETA. (If not current will be required within 90 days of hire.)
* Personal Training certification from an industry recognized and HealthFitness approved provider is a plus.
* Ability to navigate electronic onboarding and timecard systems.
* Applicants must meet hiring requirements including but not limited to pre-employment drug test.


Compensation: $20.00/hr. Eligible to make commission on Personal Training sessions in addition to hourly rate.
Brand: HealthFitness
Come join HealthFitness! Join a team that will not only utilize your current skills but will enhance them as well. We offer a comprehensive benefit package that includes Medical/Dental/Vision plans including HSA, PPO and FSA options, retirement/401(k) with employer matching program, fitness and wellness programs incentivized with medical plan discounts, certification reimbursement program, tuition reimbursement, paid new parent leave, paid Holidays and PTO (starting at 3 weeks for full-time associates), volunteer paid time off and much more.
HealthFitness is committed to leveraging the talent of a diverse workforce to create great opportunities for our people and our business. EOE/AA. Race/Color/Gender/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Religion/National Origin/Age/Disability/Veteran
For the fourth consecutive year we were selected as a Top Workplace by the Chicago Tribune. The award is based exclusively on Trustmark associate responses to an anonymous survey. The survey measured 15 key drivers of engaged cultures that are critical to the success of an organization.

title: Quality and Assurance Manager
description:
**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

The person filling this position is expected, under general supervision, to lead quality assurance and quality improvement activities using data to strengthen the child welfare prevention program. The candidate should possess a knowledge base of technical skill, superior program analysis, and a strong understanding of how decision making can be supported by timely and reliable data. The candidate should have the ability to review, analyze, interpret, and succinctly summarize information from diverse sources, including documents, surveys, and case reviews.

**Quality Assurance**

· Conduct case record reviews for compliance with ACS and OCFS standards, quality case practice, and model fidelity.

· Review case management data and documents.

· Analyze qualitative and quantitative data records and reports to monitor prevention programs for performance.

· Comply with all federal, state, and agency security and privacy policies intended to protect client confidentially.

Quality Improvement

· Guide programs in interpreting analysis of data, records, and safe measure reports to identify performance strengths, trends, and areas in need of improvement.

· Develop relevant and targeted action plans for improvement based on performance strengths, data trends, and areas of improvement.

· Manage quarterly and annual ACS outcomes, process, and practice measures and data and assist with ACS Collaborative Quality Improvement (CoQI) responsibilities.

· Coordinate quality assurance and quality improvement efforts across programs.

**Qualifications**

· Bachelor’s degree and minimum of 3 years’ experience in nonprofit management or a Master’s degree in social work, education, business, public policy, or other related field.

· Experience with NYC child welfare programs and ACS requirements and systems, Including Promis and Connections.

· Mastery of MS Office, especially Word and excel.

· Strong team player with ability to work collaboratively with a variety of stakeholders

· Ability to travel among program sites

· Experience conducting qualitative and/or quantitative research

title: Public Relations Account Associate - Travel & Hospitality
description:
**\\*Note: we are seeking someone who has 1-2 years experience working hands-on in public relations, preferably at an agency. The salary will be matched according to experience level.**

**About Redpoint**

Founded in 2002, we are a boutique PR & marketing agency that serves clients in the travel, tourism, and hospitality industries. Our culture is pretty relaxed, but still professional. When it comes to the team, we place emphasis on learning, empathy, support, kindness, and growth through risk-taking. That emphasis is probably why our historical staff turnover is so low…people enjoy working together here and they appreciate being treated like individual humans with different needs, growth patterns, and personal lives. Our clients are pretty high-profile – such as Tourism Nova Scotia, the United States Tour Operators Association, Perillo Tours, and the iconic Woodstock Inn & Resort in Vermont – so the work we do is both challenging and satisfying. Visit redpointmarketingpr.com for a full client list and deeper look into who we are.

Some helpful facts about our current situation:

* Our HQ is in NYC, but the whole staff works remotely, with occasional meetups.
* For this particular position, we’re looking for someone who lives in (or within commuting distance) to NYC.
* As your experience level and responsibilities increase, traveling to visit clients and go to conferences will become a periodic part of your job. You should be prepared to travel and love it as much as we do.
* A COVID vaccine is required. Though we’re not in the office, many of the destinations and other clients we serve require vaccinations for entry. It’s important that all our staff can participate fully in the work and travel our clients require.
* Though we’re all working remotely, we’re still all working closely together as a team. Expect to have lots of video meetings with Redpointers throughout the day. If you have a pet or a child, chances are we’ll see them often. We’re cool with that and we hope you are too.

**About You**

You have 1-2 years of hands-on PR experience, preferably working at an agency on multiple client programs.

Ideally, you have experience working with clients in the travel and hospitality industries. That’s not required but it’s definitely a plus.

At this point in your career, you have started to develop relationships with a network of journalists and influencers who know your name and pay attention to your pitches.

It would help tremendously if you already use Muck Rack or Cision.

You understand the general flow of PR account work and can handle a variety of basic PR tasks independently.

You understand the basics of crafting a story pitch.

**Your Role at Redpoint**

While you’re still learning many new aspects of PR, you’re not a square-one newbie. You’re writing solid first round drafts of press releases and pitches, engaging in some media interaction, and executing a sizeable amount of “low risk” pitching. You should also be helping the team by contributing new ideas and opportunities to your client work. Once you get settled into your role here and get familiar with your clients, your senior team members should feel comfortable with you working independently on many of your day-to-day tasks.

**Major Activities – Some Highlights of the Job**

* Help maintain productive and positive client relationships.
* Help research and develop story ideas for clients.
* Draft pitches and press releases where appropriate.
* Distribute pitches and press releases where appropriate and manage follow up.
* Engage independently in client, journalist, and influencer dialogue.
* Research and discover new media/journalist opportunities for your clients.
* Participate in client meetings and conference calls.
* Help your client teams with reporting and administration needs as appropriate.
* Help plan press visits, influencer visits, consumer events, trade events, conferences and more.

**Redpoint Benefits**

* Total Compensation Program that includes opportunities for bonuses and commission.
* 401k matching program.
* Comprehensive medical insurance – two plan options with Empire Blue Cross & Blue Shield (we pay most of the premium, you kick in a small stipend depending on which plan you choose).
* Employer paid life insurance.
* Employer paid short-term disability insurance.
* Employer paid long-term disability insurance.
* Employee Assistance Program, which provides services for counseling, legal/financial assistance, care giving assistance, employee discounts and more.
* Annual Wellness Stipend, which can be used for anything from dental bills and yoga classes to financial counseling, purchasing fitness equipment, pet insurance and much more.
* Generous PTO program, which includes a boat load of paid holidays (including Summer Fridays and office closure with full pay the week between Christmas and New Years Day) and a mandatory Rejuvenation Leave every five years of your tenure, which is four consecutive weeks off – fully paid – on top of your regular PTO.
* Growth & Development Program, which shepherds you through a variety of different learning experiences annually. This program includes a series of tailored Professional Development Retreats, a Relationship Building Program, and an annual personalized training budget to support classes, conference attendance and other learning opportunities relevant to your career development.
* Annual Career Development Assessment (CDA) program to help guide your goals and growth.
* Comprehensive New Child Caregiver Leave.
* Redpoint Social Occasions – hosted virtual outings (and sometimes in-person meetups!) arranged exclusively for Redpoint…from music concerts and safaris to influencer meet-and-greets, culinary tastings, and more.
* Travel perks! We’re fortunate to receive friends & family discounts in many travel destinations. So, besides traveling to lots of new places for work, the vacation opportunities can be pretty sweet too.

**How to Apply**

Yes, we know that cover letters are considered a drag these days, but we’re big fans of them. We are, after all, in the communications business and a letter helps us get to know you and how you approach persuasive writing. So, please send your resume and a letter telling us why you’d be a good fit for this job, based on everything you’ve read in this job posting. They can be emailed to hr@redpointmarketingpr.com. We’re willing to teach you the tools you need for the job, but if you have experience/expertise with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint), Microsoft Teams, Zoom, Canva, any Adobe tools, Cision, Muck Rack, and/or any social media channels, definitely call that out in your application!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

* 401(k) matching
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance

* Sabbatical

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Please be sure to include a cover letter. As we are in the communication business, your letter will help us get to know you and how you approach persuasive writing. Thank you!

title: Assistant Project Manager
description:
**Overview**  
Axis Construction Corp., a well-established Long Island based GC/CM firm is currently seeking an experienced Assistant Project Manager to support our New York City operations.

This position reports to the Project Manager and is responsible for providing support to the project team. The Assistant Project Manager will be coordinating the activities of a project to ensure cost, schedule, document control and quality standards are met. They will be responsible for keeping the team organized and maintaining an open line of communication between the office, subcontractors, and the field, as well as to provide project related information to the Client, Architect/Engineer and subcontractors. *Knowledge and experience in accounting, healthcare construction standards, NYC Department of Building, city agencies and construction documentation are a major plus.* 

**Duties**  
High-energy, self-motivated leader with the following skill sees:

* Responsible for change orders and NYC – HHC standard documentation.
* Create subcontract agreements and purchase orders for Project Manager to review before distributing to the subcontractors and confirm all are fully executed.
* Purchase miscellaneous/necessary materials.
* Ensure project Certificates of Insurances are current and received before subcontractors and vendors perform any work on site.
* Establish and maintain document controls to assure work is aligned with latest design documentation and approved shop drawings.
* Request project submittal items from each subcontractor. Verify all submittal conformity to plans and specifications. Manage submittal log and ensure all submittals are processed promptly.
* Submit and track all RFI’s and distribute to all team members as appropriate.
* Prepare all project meeting agendas and associated attachments as directed by Project Manager.
* Attend weekly project meetings as requested by Project Manager. Keep detailed meeting minutes for distribution to project team.
* Maintain log & distribute all project bulletins and supplemental drawings to all subcontractors as necessary.
* Collect subcontractor change orders to be reviewed by Project Manager.
* Distribute all punch lists and follow-up as necessary to ensure timely completion of punch list work.
* Assemble all close out documents for governing agencies and/or Client.

**Requirements**

* High School diploma or equivalent.
* Prefer a minimum of five or seven years on-the-job experience in a responsible Assistant position with a construction, subcontractor and/or general contracting company.
* Bachelor’s degree in construction, design, architecture, engineering or related field is preferred.
* Certificates/ trainings in Construction a plus such as OSHA Certification, Scaffolding Certification, Blueprint Reading, etc.)
* Proven written and verbal communication abilities; proficiency with computer applications, including Microsoft Office suite.
* Proficient with taking and uploading digital photographs.

**ABILITIES & KNOWLEDGE:**

* Thorough knowledge of all city agency documentation and construction. Excellent communication, organizational, supervisory and planning skills required.
* Financial knowledge is a plus.
* Advance knowledge of computer, i.e., construction scheduling programs as used by the company, Word, Excel, Project Manager software. Knowledge of the Procore software a plus.

DISCLAIMER  
The above is only intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, and as needed.

title: Business Operations Analyst
description:

We are seeking an experienced Operations Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing and optimizing business processes to improve operational efficiency and reduce costs. The successful candidate will have a strong analytical background and be skilled in data analysis and visualization tools such as Power BI. This role will require collaboration with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement and implement process changes. The Operations Analyst will also be responsible for providing data-driven insights to senior management, and will have a strong understanding of sales and revenue growth.

- Compliance Management: Ensure all products and operations comply with relevant regulations across various e-commerce platforms.

title: Housing Specialist - Homeless Families - NYC
description:
**POSITION OVERVIEW**



The Housing Specialist is responsible for addressing the housing needs of clients residing in
  

URI’s homeless shelters. The Housing Specialist assists clients as they transition from shelter to
  

permanent housing. He/she is responsible for identifying permanent housing options,
  

developing and maintaining a database of housing resources, conducting individual sessions
  

and support groups around housing issues, and providing referrals, advocacy, follow-up, and
  

assistance with housing applications. The Housing Specialist also develops partnerships with
  

government and community agencies to help increase clients’ access to meaningful housing.


***This position is open in the following boroughs: Manhattan (Harlem), Brooklyn, Bronx, Queens***


**Salary: $42,000 - $46,000**


**MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Assess clients’ housing needs and develop an individualized plan to secure safe,
  

affordable housing.
* Assess clients’ eligibility for government-financed housing programs, including subsidies,
  

and benefit programs.
* Participate as member of interdisciplinary team in determining clients’ immediate
  

needs, functional capabilities and assistance needed to stabilize housing and increase
  

independent functioning
* Conduct regular meetings with clients (at least biweekly) to review housing options, exit
  

strategies
* Develop and maintain relationships with brokers and landlords in an effort to secure a
  

pool of available apartments of all sizes and rent levels to be offered to housing-ready
  

families
* Facilitate clients ability to view at least three apartments each week. Assist clients to secure and complete applications for permanent housing and collect the necessary documents for affordable and subsidized housing.
* Engage in community outreach efforts to identify housing opportunities and maintain a
  

database of resources, including a listing of brokers, landlords, and management
  

companies.
* Develop and facilitate educational workshops and groups focused on housing (including
  

available housing resources, apartment search techniques, mock interviews, and other
  

best practices).
* Develop and maintain relationships with government partners, and supportive
  

community-based organizations.
* Participate in team meetings, case conferences and meetings with prospective brokers
  

and landlords.
* Prepare weekly housing status and other DHS required reports as directed
* Work with clients to identify ways in which to resolve adverse credit reports
* Participate in monthly staff meetings, case conferences and training seminars
  

conducted to enhance one’s skills
* Perform other duties as assigned by the Social Work Supervisor


**SPECIFICATIONS FOR EDUCATION/CERTIFICATIONS/LICENSES**


* Bachelor’s Degree in Human Services or related field.


**REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE**


* Minimum of one year counseling experience and two years of experience in housing
  

development/management, real estate or case management.
* Demonstrated sensitivity and experience with and/or knowledge of homelessness
  

within disenfranchised communities including individuals whom identify as lesbian, gay,
  

bisexual, transgender, queer, and/or HIV-affected, the elderly and individuals with
  

substance abuse and/or mental health issues.
* Familiarity with DHS regulations and DHS Cares Reporting
* Must have excellent communication skills, the ability to write and record case
  

documentation, skills in group counseling, working knowledge of family issues,
  

sensitivity to the needs of homeless families, have a demonstrated ability to advocate
  

and provide follow-up around housing issues, and able to conduct housing specific
  

workshops.
* Possess knowledge and skills necessary to develop strong linkages with city
  

and private housing agencies as well as the ability to secure permanent housing for
  

homeless population.
* Must have ability to be flexible with schedule as needed
* Employee must be computer-literate and must have knowledge of Microsoft

#### **Education**


Required* Bachelors or better in Human Services or related field

title: Associate Director, Project Manager
description:
**Company Description**  

As an Associate Director, you are an integrated production leader at Saatchi & Saatchi Wellness. You own and manage large scale client engagements and are viewed as the operation lead for your portfolio of businesses. You partner with Account Management and other internal and external stake holders to lead multiple 360 campaigns that will include higher-level launch planning exercises. You manage and mentor a team of associate, mid- and senior level project managers. You will lead by example and impart a streamlined process based on flexibility, with quality of product, budget, and timing top of mind. You have a passion for efficiency, and you are creative in your solutions. The ideal candidate must demonstrate an advanced understanding of agency operations, project management methodologies and tools. You will be responsible to lead diverse and dynamic teams to deliver solutions for our clients. You are accountable for your portfolio’s profitability and resource utilization. The successful candidate will use their superior problem-solving skills, judgment, and excellent relationship-building skills to be a leader and mentor for the team and the agency overall.

 **Job Description** **Responsibilities:**

* Demonstrate a professional demeanor, thought leadership, flexibility, and the ability to handle the ambiguity that can present itself in your daily responsibilities
* Manage a team of Project Managers of varying levels across a portfolio of clients
* Understand how to manage the design and development of large pharmaceutical and wellness integrated advertising campaigns
* Functions as the "go to” expert with a focus on flexibility when evolving process and lead the team toward solutions
* Foster senior to executive-level relationships, creating an atmosphere where issues regarding staffing, team performance, budget and client satisfaction are actively discussed
* A natural leader, with a focused interest in operations and finding efficiencies in ways that work for the agency as well as clients

**Scoping and Budget Tracking:**

* Partner with the Account and Strategy team when scoping annual deliverables by developing project descriptions, project assumptions and staffing related to the scope of work
* Responsible for revising significant scope of work changes that will impact the overall client budget, staffing, and resources for the agency
* Mentor your team by providing clear direction for project estimates and SOW revisions
* Educate your team on the fundamental economics and overall health of client business
* Partner with Finance and Account Management in leading client finance meetings and address project budget questions in real time
* Understand the relationship between scopes, burn, actuals, agency staffing, and how it relates to the brand and agency profitability
* Extensive experience negotiating with client and internal teams on project deliverables, scopes of work and staff resourcing

**Staff Development:**

* Engage in the development of mid to senior team members through mentoring and training
* Create actionable development plans accompanied by effective, ongoing dialogue with your team (including difficult, timely feedback)
* Mentor mid to senior level team members in problem solving and course correcting projects this should include departments outside of project management
* Participate in recruiting and hiring practices
* Participate in department initiatives and programs

  

**Qualifications**  

* 8-10 years project management experience in an advertising or marketing environment including:
	+ 4-5 years of experience working in pharmaceutical advertising
	+ 2-3 years of experience in launching a new drug or drug indication to market
	+ 2-3 years of experience managing and mentoring direct reports
* Demonstrated breadth of project experience including (but not limited to) big idea development, campaign execution, content production, digital and social media executions, and standard websites
* Self-starter who can manage multiple streams of business, resolve conflicts (both project and staff based) and make sound decisions that will drive a team toward a solution
* Solutions-oriented with the ability to communicate clearly and proactively with clients, internal departments and agency leaders
* Highly knowledgeable practitioner of various project management methodologies and workflows, showing a love for using and often blending the best of these to solve business needs

  

**Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Compensation Range: $91,000.00 - $154,000.00 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 09/30/24.
