Internal Applicant Salary is based upon Union Contract Negotiations  

JOB SUMMARY:
The individual, under the direction of the Associate Director, Center for Student Involvement (CSI), will lead on financial management of student organizations and activities (known as Student Activity Resource Management- SARM), student staff hiring and training, the College’s student engagement platform (Campus Groups/Archway), CSI social media, and CSI website management.
**Examples of Duties**
----------------------


DUTIES:  

* Trains CSI Professional Staff, CSI Student Staff, and club and organization leaders on Ramapo College financial policies and procedures.
* Trains aforementioned constituents on internal CSI financial policies and procedures.
* Trains SARM student staff on how to process check requisitions and purchase orders, reimbursements, purchasing card receipts, and Accounts Payable vouchers.
* Reviews said payments after student staff review before final submission to Purchasing and Accounts Payable offices.
* Liaises with staff in other offices including Purchasing and Accounts Payable.
* Organizes and leads on the student staff hiring process for returning student staff and new student staff.
* Organizes and leads on student staff training prior to the fall semester, spring semester, and monthly in-service style trainings.
* Serve as the point person for all Archway (student engagement platform through Campus Groups) for the College. This includes training constituents and sending weekly updates/announcements to all users.
* Liaise with Ramapo ITS for technical needs related to Archway.
* Leads on CSI’s main social media accounts to grow and market CSI office programs and resources
* Counsels CSI Professional Staff, CSI Student Staff, and club and organization leaders on College social media policies and procedures.
* Liaises with College’s social media team.
* Leads on CSI’s main website and various department pages.
* Counsels CSI Professional Staff on College website policies and procedures.
* Liaises with College’s website team.
* Advise and train student Allocations Committee.

  

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES  

This position requires excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a focus on attention to detail. Ability to accurately manage financial matters and communication and technical aspects of student engagement platform, website, and social media. Must possess outstanding interpersonal skills, with strong customer focus. Be willing to work on multiple projects simultaneously, and deal with confidential and sensitive matters in a professional manner. Willing to work night shifts when necessary.  


**Qualifications**
------------------


REQUIREMENTS:  

Education
Graduation from an accredited college with a Bachelor’s degree. Masters degree preferred.  

Experience  

Two years professional experience in an institution of higher education or in education, higher education or other field that is directly related to the functions of the position to be filled or equivalency as determined by the appointing authority. Applicants who do not possess the required education may substitute required experience on a year-for-year basis (30 credit hours is considered one year of college.)

title: Caregiver/Family Support Service Worker
description:
The Caregiver/Family Supports and Services worker enhances the child/youth’s ability regardless of disability (developmental, physical and/or behavioral), to function as part of a caregiver/family unit and enhance the caregiver/family’s ability to care for the child/youth in the home and/or community. Family is broadly defined, and can include families created through, birth, foster care, adoption or a self-created unit.

**Education & Experience:**

High school diploma, high school equivalency preferred, a State Education Commencement Credential (SACC) or Career Development and Occupational Studies Credential (CDOS) required, 1-year experience working with children/youth in foster care or in a Children’s Mental Health Program or related human service experience preferred

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 per hour

Expected hours: 19 per week

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

* working with youth with mental health issues: 1 year (Required)

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Licensed Insurance Customer Service Representative
description:
#### **Job Description**

**\\*\\* Candidate must have an active Property and Casualty License and Insurance Experience to be considered\\*\\***

 **Briana Ray Agency** has been a trusted name in the insurance industry for five years. As we move to our new location in Bohemia, NY, our dedication to community involvement and exceptional customer service remains strong. We actively participate in food drives and other community initiatives, reflecting our commitment to making a positive impact. Our team is in growth mode, focusing on maintaining a healthy work/life balance, offering flexibility, and fostering a supportive environment. With a small team of four in-office staff, we pride ourselves on doing things the right way, guided by our core values: CLARITY - Committed, Listeners, Advisors, Resourceful, Integrity, and Yes.

  

We are seeking a **Licensed Insurance Customer Service Representative** to join our expanding team. This position offers a competitive **base salary of $16 - $20 per hour**, along with commission and bonus opportunities. As part of our team, you'll have the chance to work with an existing book of business and contribute to our ongoing growth and success.

  

If you are a motivated, bilingual professional with a passion for customer service and a desire to grow within a supportive and dynamic team, Briana Ray Agency is the place for you. **Apply today** to become part of a company that values integrity, community involvement, and personal growth.

 **First year expected total earnings up to $50,000**


Salary: $18.00 - $22.00 per year

 **Benefits**
Annual Base Salary + Commission + Bonus Opportunities


Paid Time Off (PTO)


Flexible Schedule


Health Insurance


Hands on Training


Career Growth Opportunities


Retirement Plan


Evenings Off


Bonus Opportunities

Weekends Off

Professional Development


Advancement Opportunities

Performance Bonuses


Professional Work Environment

Personal Workspace


Active Community Involvement


Monday - Tuesday (9am - 7pm) Work Schedule


Wednesday - Friday (9am - 5pm) Work Schedule


Dental Insurance


Life Insurance


Vision Insurance


Mon-Fri Schedule

 **Responsibilities**  

* Cultivates and maintains strong relationships with clients.
* Ensure ongoing engagement and satisfaction through consistent communication.
* Identify opportunities to upsell additional products to existing clients.
* Process insurance policy payments accurately and efficiently.
* Implement strategies to exceed quotas and performance objectives.
* Prepare and issue insurance documents promptly and accurately.
* Implement retention strategies to foster loyalty and satisfaction.


  

**Requirements**  

* **License Requirements**: Candidate must have **an active Insurance License** to be considered.
* Bilingual in Spanish.
* Meticulous attention to detail in all tasks and responsibilities.
* Collaborative and supportive team member who fosters a positive work environment.
* Clear and effective communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Demonstrates professionalism and respect in all interactions within the office environment.

  

**Company Description**  

We are an Elite Allstate Agency specializing in Home, Life, and Auto insurance. Our dedicated staff work incredibly hard to ensure that our clients are completely satisfied! We only hire the best and most dedicated employees to our team.

title: Licensed Insurance Customer Service Sales Representative
description:
#### **Job Description**

**\\*Candidate must have New York State insurance license to be considered\\***

  

Discover a new opportunity at the Edward Lehmann Agency, an established insurance agency located in Plainview, New York. As a licensed Insurance Account Manager, you'll be joining a team that values integrity, professionalism, and dedicated service to our clients. We are committed to providing personalized insurance solutions while fostering a sense of community within our organization.


If you are passionate about insurance sales, adept at building relationships, and thrive in a collaborative environment, this role is tailor-made for you. Join us in delivering exceptional service and making a positive impact on our clients' lives.


Salary: $55000.00 - $99000.00 per year

 **Benefits**
Annual Base Salary + Commission + Bonus Opportunities


Paid Time Off (PTO)


Hands on Training


Mon-Fri Schedule


Career Growth Opportunities


Retirement Plan


Commissions


Health Insurance


Bonus Opportunity


Appreciation Lunches


Paid Holidays


Birthday Day off


Out office team building events


Industry Leading Commission Structure

 **Responsibilities**  

Client Management: Build and maintain relationships with clients, providing personalized service and addressing their insurance concerns.


Policy Review: Analyze client policies, identify coverage gaps, and recommend appropriate coverage options.


Claims Assistance: Assist clients in filing claims, liaising with insurance companies, and ensuring timely resolution.


Risk Assessment: Evaluate clients' risks and exposures to recommend comprehensive insurance packages.


Client Education: Educate clients on insurance products, coverage details, and policy features to empower them to make informed decisions.

  

  

**Requirements** **Licensing: Active New York State insurance license required**


Experience: Previous experience in insurance account management or customer service preferred.


Interpersonal Skills: Excellent communication and relationship-building skills.


Detail-Oriented: Ability to accurately manage client records and policy information.


Organizational Skills: Demonstrated ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively.


Professionalism: Maintain a positive attitude, integrity, and professionalism in all interactions.

 **Company Description**  

Our Agency is located in Plainview, NY specializing in Home, Life, and Auto insurance products. We care about our clients, and it shows in our results as we have achieved many awards since opening our doors. Our dedicated staff works incredibly well as a team and always put the customer first. Apply to our team today!

title: Client Experience Concierge
description:
Ridgewood Financial Advisors is the parent company of multiple brands, and you'll be involved with two of them: Leeds Accounting & Tax Services and Vision Retirement. Though headquartered in Maywood, this position occasionally requires work in our Ridgewood, New Jersey office.

We are currently seeking a full-time Client Experience Concierge to assist us in providing outstanding and consistent experiences to our clients. As we embark on an exciting new phase of our business, you'll have a unique opportunity to play a significant role in our success. Your role as a Client Concierge is not just important; it's integral to our operations. This is your chance to join a successful team and work in an environment where your input truly matters, surrounded by individuals who are passionate about helping others achieve their goals.

**What You’ll Be Doing**  
For starters, you’ll be required to live our values. We base all our decisions on these, including who we promote. That said, your primary responsibility will be to deliver outstanding experiences to our employees, vendors, and clients. Here are some specifics:

* Answer inbound phone calls with the highest level of professionalism and hospitality on a wide variety of existing and prospective client requests
* Respond to email messages in a friendly, timely, clear, and concise manner
* Make outbound calls to get feedback on and improve experiences throughout the client journey
* Liaise with internal staff (bookkeepers, CPAs, financial advisors, and operations) to ensure clients receive outstanding experiences
* Take the lead on resolving any client issues
* Process packages, faxes, and mail, which may be either outgoing or incoming, in an accurate and timely manner
* Schedule appointments for clients and prospects
* Input data into our accounting and ancillary systems
* Scan and file documents
* Perform other tasks or projects as assigned by management

**Things We Require**  
One of the most important qualities we're looking for is a genuine desire to help others. Along with strong verbal and written communication skills, we are seeking candidates with a bachelor’s degree who are detail-oriented self-starters, capable of multitasking, and comfortable with technology. Additionally, due to the time-sensitive nature of tax returns, the candidate must be able to manage a high volume of work and meet the demands of our peak tax season, which lasts 8-10 weeks per year.

You can review the Vision Retirement site at www.visionretirement.com. A new Leeds Accounting & Tax Services site will launch next month.

title: Print Operator / Inventory & Receiving
description:
**ob Description:**

We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Print Machine Operator & Inventory Specialist to join our team. This dual-role position is critical to our production process and involves operating our hot stamp machine to print custom poker chips, as well as managing receiving and inventory tasks.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Machine Operation:**
* Operate and maintain the hot stamp machine to produce high-quality printed poker chips according to company standards.
* Ensure accuracy in the printing process, including proper alignment, color matching, and design application.
* Conduct routine maintenance and troubleshooting of the hot stamp machine to minimize downtime and ensure efficient production.
* Monitor the production process to ensure consistency and quality control.
* **Inventory Management:**
* Receive, inspect, and verify incoming shipments of materials and products.
* Manage inventory levels, ensuring that materials are available for production while minimizing excess stock.
* Organize and maintain inventory records, ensuring accuracy in quantities and locations.
* Perform regular inventory counts and reconcile discrepancies as needed.
* **Additional Responsibilities:**
* Collaborate with the production team to meet deadlines and achieve production goals.
* Assist with packaging and shipping of finished products when necessary.
* Maintain a clean and organized work area, following safety protocols at all times.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience operating a print machine or similar machinery is preferred.
* Strong attention to detail and commitment to producing high-quality work.
* Basic understanding of inventory management and receiving procedures.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent organizational and time-management skills.
* Physical ability to lift and move materials as needed.

**How to Apply:** Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your relevant experience. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Product Manager, Data Management
description:
Data
We’re looking for a Product Manager to drive the roadmap and strategic direction within Spotify’s Data Management Product Area.
Location


New York
Job type


Permanent  


In Data Management, our solutions impact hundreds of Spotify engineers and data scientists, and thousands of daily processing jobs, ultimately enhancing the user experience for hundreds of millions of users through more data-informed recommendations and a better overall experience!  

As a technical product manager, you collaborate with a group of Product Managers to identify and prioritize areas where the team can make a greater impact on the Spotify data community, as well as a dedicated team of engineers to improve several critical capabilities:* Providing the ability to manage all of Spotify's data via the Data Catalog, as well as enabling discovery as part of the larger Backstage ecosystem
* Guaranteeing consistent data available once safely published for reliable use
* Provide Data Practitioners at Spotify with an in-depth understanding of the flow of data and their relationships across the Data Ecosystem

  

Being part of Spotify’s Data Platform, your work will intersect with teams in the broader Data Management Product Area and other engineers across the Studio and the wider organization.
What You'll Do

* Define and drive overall product vision, strategy and metrics across teams in Data Platform, that contribute to data catalog and lineage engineering and products.
* Through your understanding of the domain and compliance requirements, collaborate with product, engineering, and data science teams to gather feedback and requirements.
* You will create, update and evangelize how data is being managed and maintained, in alignment with Data Protection and our larger Storage strategies, that improves the experience for people working with data at Spotify.
* Work closely with other Product Managers in the Data Platform and larger Platform organization to define and address gaps in Spotify’s offering with the goal of providing a world-class data development experience at Spotify
* Work passionately to ensure your team is focusing on the right things, balancing short versus long term needs. A healthy balance of innovation, support and maintenance is key for all successful teams at Spotify.

Who You Are

* You have 3+ years of technical product management experience
* You have thorough experience with data driven product development.
* A deep technical understanding of data management in a cloud-based environment.
* You can translate you and your team’s knowledge & experience, internal policies and external requirements to use-cases and prioritized work.
* You're resilient and love the idea of having end-to-end responsibility for the product’s success and getting things done!
* You are an excellent communicator and storyteller, communicating concepts and ideas in different formats.
* You have an ability to operate effectively and autonomously across multiple teams in situations of ambiguity, with only high-level direction

Where You'll Be

* You’ll be based in New York.

Our global benefits


Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Learn about life at Spotify


The United States base range for this position is $112,298 - $160,425 plus equity. The benefits available for this position include health insurance, six month paid parental leave, 401(k) retirement plan, monthly meal allowance, 23 paid days off, 13 paid flexible holidays, paid sick leave. These ranges may be modified in the future.

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
**About Us**

With a robust foundation of 20 years, we've driven unprecedented success for over 800

global e-commerce brands and are expanding rapidly. Our strength lies in our

proprietary AI-Marketing platform (LXRInsights) and a dynamic team of 120+

professionals dedicated to redefining the e-commerce marketing landscape. As we

scale, your expertise will be pivotal in propelling our digital presence and growing our

AI-First Digital Agency Brand. We are headquartered in Princeton, NJ, and partner with

global retail and direct-to-consumer brands in North America and Europe to help them

predictably find, engage, and win new, high-value customers online and drive explosive

revenue growth.

We cherish our diverse, Go-Giver culture. Our offices in Princeton, NJ, and Hyderabad,

India are filled with kind, passionate, fanatically analytical, and responsible team

members obsessed with combining human expertise with AI to deliver client delight.

Since 2016, through our non-profit organization, Udaan (https://udaan-trust.org/), we

have been helping underprivileged girls in Telangana (India) pursue dreams of a better

life by sponsoring their high school and college education and helping them secure jobs

in leading organizations.

For more information, please visit www.netelixir.com and our blog

https://www.netelixir.com/blog/.

**Role Overview**

We are seeking a high-energy, results-driven Sales Hunter to join our team. This role is

responsible for identifying, prospecting, and securing new business opportunities. The

ideal candidate has a strong understanding of digital marketing solutions and is skilled

at selling to senior-level decision-makers. You will play a critical role in expanding our

client base and driving our growth to new heights

**What You’ll Be Doing**

● Prospecting and Outreach:

○ Conduct outbound prospecting through cold calls, emails, LinkedIn, and

other channels to generate leads and engage with potential clients.

○ Perform at least 300 outreach calls/emails per week with the goal of

setting meetings

○ Develop and execute personalized outreach strategies that resonate with

target audiences.

○ Leverage CRM tools and automation to streamline outreach efforts and

track engagement.

● Pipeline Development:

○ Build and maintain a robust pipeline of qualified prospects across targeted

industries.

○ Ensure consistent pipeline activity with a focus on top-of-funnel lead

generation.

○ Track and report on key metrics such as lead conversion rates, meeting-

to-opportunity ratio, and sales cycle length.

● Sales Execution:

○ Conduct thorough needs analysis to identify client pain points and align

them with our AI-driven digital marketing solutions.

○ Present compelling value propositions to key stakeholders and decision-

makers.

○ Manage the entire sales process, from initial outreach to contract

negotiation and closing.

○ Meet or exceed quarterly and annual sales targets, contributing to overall

company growth.

● Collaboration and Reporting:

○ Collaborate closely with marketing and client strategy teams to ensure

smooth handoffs and consistent messaging.

○ Provide regular updates on outreach activities, pipeline status, and sales

performance through CRM reporting.

○ Share insights and feedback from prospect interactions to inform future

marketing and product strategies.

**What Makes You A Great Candidate**

You have:

● 3+ years with a proven track record of success in B2B sales, preferably in a

digital marketing agency or related industry catering to retail brands

● A Bachelor's Degree is necessary. Business Smarts is a MUST.

● Proven track record of meeting or exceeding outreach and sales metrics in a

fast-paced, competitive environment.

● A working understanding of digital marketing strategies and their application

in the retail sector.

● Ability to work independently and thrive in a high-performance sales

environment.

● Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build

rapport with clients and effectively convey complex ideas in a persuasive

manner.

.

**Why You’ll Love Us**

● We are guided by our organizational values of respect, customer delight,

equal opportunity for all, and an obsession with quality.

● Our dedication to helping businesses succeed online drives us forward.

● We believe a diverse team is a strong team.

● Every voice has a prominent place in the conversation, and we consider it

our responsibility to listen and learn from them.

● Work-life balance is vital to us.

● Our team member’s fulfillment and growth are important to us, and we foster

this through learning programs, career development, and people initiatives.

● There is never a shortage of treats in our office and opportunities to enjoy all

the diverse eats that Princeton has to offer

● We work hard and play harder. We create memories through laughter, art,

and dance.

Take a peek: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ag6jFiEB6hU

title: Warehouse Safety Liaison
description:
**Warehouse Safety Liaison** 

**About us:**

We are the growing leader in the furniture delivery industry. With multiple locations throughout the country, our goal is simple: To provide our clients and customers a 5 Star Delivery Experience.

We are proud of our experienced, dedicated, and professional staff and as our rapid company growth continues we require that we constantly add motivated, enthusiastic individuals committed to providing the same exceptional customer service that is the hallmark of our success.

Our mission is to ensure memories are delivered one piece of furniture at a time, on time, every time. We are looking for individuals experienced in logistics and transportation to add to our team who will contribute to achieving our mission.

**Job Summary:**

The Warehouse Safety Liaison is responsible for supporting warehouse operations while ensuring compliance with all safety protocols. This role involves working 80% of the time in warehouse operations and 20% of the time reviewing and implementing safety procedures. The ideal candidate will have a strong attention to detail, excellent organizational skills, and a commitment to maintaining a safe working environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Warehouse Operations (80%):**

* Perform daily warehouse tasks including receiving, storing, and distributing materials and products.
* Operate warehouse equipment such as forklifts and other machinery safely and efficiently.
* Maintain accurate inventory records and conduct regular inventory counts.
* Ensure the warehouse is organized and clean, adhering to all housekeeping standards.
* Assist with order fulfillment, including picking, packing, and shipping orders.
* Support the loading and unloading of trucks, ensuring all shipments are handled with care.

**Safety Protocols (20%):**

* Review and stay updated on all safety regulations and company safety policies.
* Conduct regular safety inspections and audits to identify potential hazards and ensure compliance.
* Develop and implement safety training programs for warehouse staff.
* Report and document any safety incidents, near misses, or violations promptly.
* Collaborate with management to address and resolve safety concerns.
* Promote a culture of safety awareness and proactive risk management within the warehouse.

**Requirements:**

* High school diploma or equivalent
* 1 year minimum of previous machine operating experience desired
* Bilingual (fluent in English and Spanish)
* Ability to lift and move heavy objects (up to 50 lbs) regularly.
* Standing, walking, bending, and reaching for extended periods.
* Ability to operate warehouse equipment safely.

**Working Conditions:**

* Warehouse environment with exposure to varying temperatures and noise levels.
* May require occasional overtime or weekend work depending on operational needs.

The **Warehouse Safety Liaison** plays a critical role in ensuring both efficient warehouse operations and a safe working environment for all employees.

**Job Type:** Full-time

Metropolitan Warehouse is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $19.50 per hour

* What are your salary expectations (hourly)?

* Machine Operating: 1 year (Preferred)

* Spanish (Preferred)

title: Addiction Medicine APP
description:
**Job description**

Addiction Medicine, Full Time Nurse Practitioner or Physician Assistant

Schedule: 7 shifts every 2 weeks, alternating weekends; other scheduling options.

Seeking full-time Physician Assistant or Nurse Practitioner with previous addiction experience in MAT and the treatment of substance use disorders (SUD). This position is a full-time position, with rotating daytime shifts. There is the opportunity to pick up additional overtime hours as desired.

The field of addiction medicine is growing and this position will enable you to gain experience providing wide-ranging treatment in the area of addiction medicine, including MAT, as a member of our inpatient and outpatient detoxification and rehabilitation team.

The right candidate will have an opportunity to work with a committed team of professionals to provide linkage and increased access to evidence-based SUD treatments.

Buprenorphine experience in the inpatient and outpatient setting is preferred.Inpatient and/or outpatient detoxification/rehabilitation is preferred.

**Highlights include:**

* Assessment and management of candidates presenting with substance use disorders.
* Coordinate patients’ progress and treatment plans with an active multi-disciplinary team including counselors, nursing, and psychiatrists.
* Evaluate patients for medication-assisted treatments, working collaboratively with staff to ensure continuity of care after discharge.
* Acquire knowledge of the most up-to-date evidence-based practices in the field.

title: Accounting Clerk
description:
Richard Grubb and Associates, a fast-growing small consulting firm is seeking to hire an accounting clerk. To learn more about our company please visit our website at www.rgaincorporated.com.

The Accounting Clerk reports to the CEO and will be an in-person position. This individual will be primarily responsible for preparing and sending invoices, collecting payments from customers, and processing incoming expenses along with expense reports. The ideal candidate should be a career-minded individual possessing strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills, computer proficiency, able to work independently and in a team, and has a positive, focused, and organized demeanor.

**Position: Full-Time Accounting Clerk**

We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented full-time Bookkeeper with a background in architecture/engineering environments to join our team.

**Responsibilities:**

* Prepare financial reports and ensure accurate bookkeeping
* Track costs and manage expense reports
* Handle accounts payable and receivable
* Reconcile bank statements and ensure compliance with financial regulations
* Collaborate with our multidisciplinary team to support financial operations
* Proven working experience processing accounts payable or accounts receivable
* Data entry skills and strong Microsoft Excel/Word skills
* Knowledge of local, state and federal laws regarding finances and taxation is a plus
* Solid understanding of basic bookkeeping and accounting principles
* Working knowledge of Sage 50 software and Unanet/Cosential a plus

**Requirements:**

* 1- 3 years of experience in bookkeeping, preferably with small businesses
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word and Excel) and Sharepoint
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Strong attention to detail, ethical conduct, self-direction, and results orientated
* Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Experience in the A/E industry is preferred
* Daily tasks associated with accounts payable, accounts receivable, general ledger, cash, and bank reconciliation
* Preparing bills, invoices, bank deposits, and AR aging reports
* Entering payables, data entry
* Prepares asset, liability, and capital account entries by compiling and analyzing account information
* Minor administrative duties as needed by CEO

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 1 year of bookkeeping experience (required)
* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field (preferred) or equivalent experience
* Experience with Unanet/Cosential a plus

title: Public Relations Account Assistant
description:
**About Redpoint**

Founded in 2002, we are a boutique PR & marketing agency that serves clients in the travel, tourism, and hospitality industries. Our culture is pretty relaxed, but still professional. When it comes to the team, we place emphasis on learning, empathy, support, kindness, and growth through risk-taking. That emphasis is probably why our staff turnover is so low…people enjoy working together here and they appreciate being treated like individual humans with different needs and growth patterns. Our clients are pretty high-profile – such as Tourism Nova Scotia, the United States Tour Operators Association, Perillo Tours, and the iconic Woodstock Inn & Resort in Vermont – so the work we do is both challenging and satisfying. Visit redpointmarketingpr.com for a full client list and deeper look into who we are.

Some helpful facts about our current situation:

· Our HQ is in NYC, but the whole staff works remotely, with occasional meetups.

· For this particular position, we’re looking for someone who lives in (or within commuting distance) to NYC.

· As your experience level and responsibilities increase, traveling to visit clients and go to conferences will become a periodic part of your job. You should be prepared to travel and love it as much as we do.

· A COVID vaccine is required. Though we’re not in the office, many of the destinations and other clients we serve require vaccinations for entry. It’s important that all our staff can participate fully in the work and travel our clients require.

· Though we’re all working remotely, we’re still all working closely together as a team. Expect to have lots of video meetings with Redpointers throughout the day. If you have a pet or a child, chances are we’ll see them often. We’re cool with that and we hope you are too.

**Your Role at Redpoint**

An account assistant on the PR team is an entry level position here at Redpoint. Maybe you’ve had some PR/marketing internship experience in the past, but we don’t expect you to come in having had ANY experience or knowing a ton about PR. In addition to being the support backbone of your PR client teams, your biggest responsibility is to learn. Be a sponge. Soak up information about everything we do by enthusiastically trying anything you’re asked to tackle, asking a ton of questions, and observing everything that goes on at Redpoint. Though this is a junior position, it doesn’t make your role – or your position within our company – any less important. Not only are your client responsibilities vital to the success of their programs, but also, you’re expected to be an engaged participant in Redpoint’s culture and company activities…from staff meetings to company projects and everything in between. You’ll get to know and work closely with everyone at Redpoint, including the two owners.

Please note: our entry level job salary is $45,000 plus all the benefits listed below. If you have a year of related, full-time PR work experience (post college), you may be a notch above entry level... in which case we may consider you for a slightly higher salary and title.

**Major Activities – Highlights of the Job**

* Assist your client teams with daily program activities, including press release/pitch distribution, press visit planning, photo library management, special events, and more.
* Participate in client meetings and help move the agenda forward.
* Tons of research on tons of subjects relevant to client needs.
* Monitor Google Alerts and other media tracking tools for each of your clients daily and handle each piece of news according to each client’s needs.
* Monitor each of your clients’ social media and online review channels daily and share noteworthy comments, questions, or issues with your teams.
* Assist your client teams with all client reporting.
* Respond to journalist and client requests as appropriate.
* Develop understanding of how client programs are created and each element is implemented.
* Perform independent special projects for clients as directed by supervisors. FYI, these are rarely boring because our clients do cool things! You could be buying group theater tickets, sourcing an obscure recipe, locating a dog that can skateboard, or plotting out a multi-province travel itinerary in Canada. It’s rarely the same thing twice.
* Learn all aspects of the various media (consumer, trade, print, broadcast, online, podcast, etc.) and develop an understanding of how each is relevant to our clients, and why.
* Provide creative input on marketing and PR ideas for all company clients.
* Participate proactively and thoughtfully in Redpoint staff meetings and company projects.

**Redpoint Benefits**

· Total Compensation Program that includes opportunities for bonuses and commission.

· 401k matching program.

· Comprehensive medical insurance – three plan options with Empire Blue Cross & Blue Shield (we pay most of the premium, you kick in a small stipend depending on which plan you choose).

· Employer paid life insurance.

· Employer paid short-term disability insurance.

· Employer paid long-term disability insurance.

· Employee Assistance Program, which provides services for counseling, legal/financial assistance, care giving assistance, employee discounts and more.

· Annual Wellness Stipend, which can be used for anything from dental bills and yoga classes to financial counseling, purchasing fitness equipment, pet insurance and much more.

· Generous PTO program, which includes a boat load of paid holidays (including Summer Fridays and office closure with full pay the week between Christmas and New Years Day) and a mandatory Rejuvenation Leave every five years of your tenure, which is four consecutive weeks off – fully paid – on top of your regular PTO.

· Growth & Development Program, which shepherds you through a variety of different learning experiences annually. This program includes a series of tailored Professional Development Retreats, a Relationship Building Program, and an annual personalized training budget to support classes, conference attendance and other learning opportunities relevant to your career development.

· Annual Career Development Assessment (CDA) program to help guide your goals and growth.

· Comprehensive New Child Caregiver Leave.

· Monthly Redpoint Social Occasions – hosted virtual outings arranged exclusively for Redpoint…from music concerts and safaris to influencer meet-and-greets, culinary tastings, and more.

· Travel perks! We’re fortunate to receive friends & family discounts in many travel destinations. So, besides traveling to lots of new places for work, the vacation opportunities can be pretty sweet too.

**How to Apply**

Yes, we know that cover letters are considered a drag these days, but we’re big fans of them. We are, after all, in the communications business and a letter helps us get to know you. So, please send your resume and a letter telling us why you’d be a good fit for this job, based on everything you’ve read in this job posting. They can be emailed to hr@redpointmarketingpr.com. We’re willing to teach you the tools you need for the job, but if you have experience/expertise with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint), Microsoft Teams, Zoom, Canva, any Adobe tools, Cision, Muck Rack, and/or any social media channels, definitely call that out in your application!

title: Director, CX Strategy
description:
In the journey of life, your career should make a difference.



At Inizio Evoke, we come together—to do the best work, in the best possible place. We're all in. Because it's everyone's role to make health more human™.


**Description**



CX strategy drives activation planning for our clients, providing multichannel marketing expertise to the multidisciplinary teams that serve our clients. Along with client work, this team leads the agency's thought leadership activities and is involved in our business development process.



The **Director, CX Strategy** will lead the creation of integrated marketing and communications plans for a specific set of clients and brands. You will be comfortable taking ownership of your accounts, while collaborating with other engagement strategists, other strategy team members, and colleagues from other disciplines (eg, account management, project management, creative, technology, and media). This is a high-visibility leadership position within the agency and comes with heavy client-facing responsibilities. You will report to the Vice President, CX Strategy.


**You will:**


* Lead research efforts in pursuit of actionable insights around important brand challenges, top commercial opportunities, and customer beliefs, behaviors, and needs
* Translate this knowledge into annual strategic and tactic plans that address the right strategic levers and comprise an optimized mix of channels, tactics, content, and messaging
* Elevate the agency as a strategic partner and trusted advisor to clients by demonstrating a full understanding of their businesses and the ability to craft actionable solutions to their challenges
* Oversee the execution of scoped projects from conception through execution to ensure strategic understanding remains intact
* Partner with Account teams to identify opportunities for account growth
* Bring new innovative thinking to clients that propel their businesses forward
* Work with Creative teams to bring brand campaigns to life through smart tactical programs that deliver inspiring customer experiences
* Collaborate with the Analytics team to define measurement plans, contribute analysis to performance reports, and develop optimization recommendations
* Play an active leadership role in our business development process, supporting proposal development and new business pitches
* Keep current on marketing best practices; trends, channels, technologies, and partners —both within and outside of healthcare
* Be an expert for the agency and its clients; write POVs and blog articles; lead training and workshops; and sharing best practices, emerging trends, and innovations


**Qualifications:**


* 5+ years of agency experience with a foundation in healthcare/pharmaceutical marketing
* 3+ years in a digital strategy, engagement strategy, or channel planning role
* Experience marketing to healthcare professionals
* Experience launching new healthcare/pharma products (or new indications)
* Main discipline expertise: market research & insights, omnichannel marketing, digital marketing, customer relationship management (CRM), relationship marketing (RM), customer segmentation, content marketing, CX & UX strategy, marketing & sales automation, digital media, social media, search (SEO/SEM), event/experiential marketing, marketing analytics
* Experience with Veeva, including familiarity with platform capabilities and best practices
* Hands-on experience with Web analytics platforms and social media listening tools
* Can manage client relationships and navigate multi-stakeholder environments
* Hands-on experience with agency new business efforts, including proposal writing and pitching
* Proficient in creating impactful presentations
* Must be willing to travel up to 25%


Inizio Evoke provides an exciting and flexible work environment, great compensation packages and outstanding company paid benefits including medical, dental, 401(k), tuition reimbursement and flexible time off.


*We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.*

title: Community Outreach Coordinator
description:
Praesum Healthcare:  

  

Position Title: Community Outreach Coordinator  

  

Praesum Healthcare started in 2004 has grown to include over thirty centers across six states, having served over 200,000 patients during its care. With a proven track record of success in the mental health and substance recovery industry, Praesum has been accredited by the Joint Commission and holds licenses and certifications in the states in which they operate. Sunrise Detox Center | Drug & Alcohol Detox offers medically supervised programs to help people with mental health and substance use disorders start their recovery. Ten locations are available across New Jersey, Georgia, Florida, New York, and Massachusetts. These provide safe and comfortable medical detox for alcohol, opiates, and most prescription drugs. The Counseling Center is a leading provider of comprehensive outpatient services, offering medically supervised programs to help individuals overcome addiction and continue their journey toward recovery. The fourteen locations throughout New Jersey, New York, Massachusetts, and Georgia offer outpatient treatment for addiction, alcoholism, and co-occurring mental health disorders associated with substance use. Evolve Recovery Centers are accredited residential facilities. They have four locations in Florida, Georgia, New Jersey, and Massachusetts. These facilities treat the mental and behavioral causes of substance use disorders.  

  

Community Outreach Coordinator Job description:  

Develops and grows professional relationships with Primary Care Physicians, hospitals, and other key decision makers of prospective referral resources with the intent of creating long lasting referral relationships that allow patients the opportunity to utilize Sunrise Detox Centers as part of their treatment process.  

  

This position is responsible for:  

* Developing and growing professional relationships with hospitals, therapists, medical professionals and other key decision makers of prospective referral resources by use of but not limited to; door-to-door, telephonic use, one on one meetings, presentations, professional organizations, and social electronic media.
* Consistently meeting weekly and monthly activity expectations for door-to-door check-in's with potential referral partners.
* Monthly contribution of referrals from personal accounts across all of Praesum Healthcare's Behavioral Health programs and locations with a specific focus on local market.
* Understanding their geographic area for the potential of creating professional referral relationships for best utilization opportunities of our detox and counseling treatment programs.
* Assisting in the development of marketing/PR materials that will be utilized for building/maintaining relationships for their geographic area and/or company.
* Contributing to the development of and/or participates in seminars and company campaigns for the benefit of obtaining prospective referral resources.
* Working closely with the Senior Management of the local facilities in helping to obtain/maintain optimal revenue by achieving maximum referrals for the center’s treatment programs and services.
* Directly assisting and supporting the marketing department personnel at key meetings with executive level audiences (expected daily local travel and occasional overnight) and can encompass nights and weekends.
* Records daily activity through CRM software

  

The ideal person will have:  

* An entrepreneurial sprit
* Self-sufficient and self-motivated
* Behavioral Health/Substance Abuse outreach experience preferred but not required
* Excellent People and Communication skills
* Knowledge of Microsoft products and Salesforce
* Bachelor’s Degree preferred but not required

  

Community Outreach Coordinator Schedule:  

* Full Time

  

Community Outreach Coordinator Compensation  

* Competitive Salary commensurate upon experience and location
* Bonus Eligible

  

Full time employees may be eligible for the following:  

* Insurance: Medical, Dental, Vision, and STD options
* Medical FSA and Dependent Care Account
* 401k with company match up to 5%
* Accrued Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Education reimbursement
* Career Advancement Opportunities

  

\\*\\*\\* This job does NOT sponsor visa's and we are unable to consider out of country applicants \\*\\*\\*  

  

If you are interested in this opportunity or know someone that you respect who would be a good fit for this position, please email:  

Chase - Chase@praesumhealthcare.com Director of Talent Acquisition  

Clay- Clay@praesumhealthcare.com Healthcare Recruiter

title: Trade Sales Rep | Lighting Hardware Furniture | Full Time | Rejuvenation NYC
description:
**About the Brand**

Rejuvenation is a general store for home improvement whose mission is to add real value to homes, buildings, and projects. From the front porch to the back door, we offer lighting, hardware and functional home goods based on the best pieces of the past, designed for today, and made to last for years to come. Rejuvenation was acquired by Williams-Sonoma, Inc. in 2011; the majority of its hardwired lighting products are made to order at its manufacturing facility in Portland, Oregon, and it prides itself on partnering with American craftspeople and vendors whenever possible.

**About the Team**

Our mission is to enhance the quality of our customers’ lives at home. We put the customer at the center of everything we do, every day. Our corporate values that guide our actions and decisions are our People First culture, customers, quality, shareholders, integrity, and corporate responsibility.

**Overview of the Store Trade Specialist role**

You will be responsible for exceeding the trade sales plan in the local trade area and creating a thriving customer community. Activities include networking with area trade associations, neighborhood associations, sales prospecting and providing a level of service that builds relationships. You will act as a trade liaison with all retail trade customers, as well as a regional brand advocate within the community. You will help support the goals and strategies set by Marketing and Retail Management to grow our business.

**Responsibilities**

· Develop, manage and grow the trade customer base in a defined client segment and geographic region of the retail store

· Identify area home, neighborhood, preservation and other associations to reach out to and build a connection with

· Develop and execute events that drive traffic and position Rejuvenation as a resource

· Promote Rejuvenation products and services to prospective and existing trade clients through a combination of opportunities that include in-store service, telephone contacts, site visits, and in-store events trainings and trade shows

· Build and maintain extensive knowledge base of building activity within retail trade area

· Works with store sales associates to provide timely trade related information, and to assist other sales associates with identifying potential trade prospects and customers.

· Builds strong connections with Call Center and WSI Contract teams, to leverage resources and build overall trade businesses.

· Supports retail store in customer service and operations as needed. Performs other duties as assigned by management, including opening and closing duties as Key Holder.

**Criteria**

· Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, to include Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

· Strong product and procedural knowledge specific to remodeling and building trades, with emphasis on period residential and commercial materials, design, and construction

· Prior experience in Microsoft Dynamix AX, Sales Force Management, and POS systems a plus

· Strong aptitude for customer service and sales, with a high energy "can do" approach

· Proven ability to achieve results both independently and through others

· 2-3 years outside sales experience with a strong emphasis in customer service and delivery of set goal plan

**Physical Requirements**

· Must be able to be mobile on the sales floor for extended periods of time

· Must be able to lift and mobilize medium to large items, up to 75 lbs., while utilizing appropriate equipment and safety techniques

· Full time associates are expected to have open availability to meet the needs of the business.

· Part-Time Flex associates must be available to work a of 15 hours per week, including two regularly scheduled shifts on the weekend (Saturday and Sunday) and two during the week (Monday to Friday). Associates must be available for annual inventory and entire holiday season (November and December). Weekend availability cannot fall on the same day; an associate must be available on two separate days (Saturday and Sunday).

**Our Mission Around Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**

We firmly believe that working in a culture focused on diversity, equity, and inclusion spurs innovation, creates healthy and high-performing teams, and delivers superior customer experiences. We will create and nurture a global company culture where we confidently bring our authentic selves to work every day: where the only criteria for advancement are the quality of our work, the contributions we make to our teams and the business, and our ability to lead; and where our individual differences—whatever they may be—are valued, explored and appreciated.

**Benefits Just for You**

This role offers a competitive compensation package including pay and benefits. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. The anticipated pay range for this role will be: $55,000-$65,000 / year

Depending on your position and your location, here are a few highlights of what you might be eligible for:

· A generous discount on all Williams-Sonoma, Inc. brands

· A 401(k) plan and other investment opportunities

· A wellness program that supports your physical, financial and emotional health

· Paid vacations and holidays (full-time)

· Health benefits, dental and vision insurance, including same-sex domestic partner benefits (full-time)

**Your Journey in Continued Learning**

· Individual development plans and career pathing conversations

· Annual performance appraisals

· Cross-brand and cross-functional career opportunities

· Online learning opportunities through brand specific resources and WSI University

· Leadership development opportunities

*WSI will not now or in the future commence an immigration case or "sponsor" an individual for this position (for example, H-1B or other employment-based immigration*

*This role is not eligible for relocation assistance*

title: In-House Superintendent
description:
**JOB PURPOSE:**

Responsible for the maintenance and housekeeping of interiors and exteriors of all properties owned by CenterLight Healthcare.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:**

- Inspects all heating systems and performs necessary repairs and maintenance to gas and oil systems.

- Inspects roofs, sewers, drains, and all public areas to determine the necessary maintenance and housekeeping.

- Inspects all utility rooms to determine repairs needed.

- Assist the Maintenance Mechanic with day-to-day operation, removal of garbage, cleaning exterior and chute.

- Assist with completed all repairs found during annual inspections

- Performs other daily and monthly preventive maintenance.

- Determines the priority of work orders.

- Participate in on call rotation and assignments routinely, and as needed.

- Completes annual evaluation for the Maintenance Mechanics

- Schedules work orders and plans completes repairs.

- Maintains supplies inventory and notifies Management Office

- Performs necessary electrical, plumbing, and carpentry repairs, as needed.

- Projects future major and minor repairs and obtains necessary cost estimates.

- Prepares and submits all necessary administrative reports.

- All other duties as assigned.

**Weekly Hours:** 40

**Schedule:** 8:00AM – 5:00PM

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

**Education:**

- High school diploma. Technical knowledge of building systems

**Other:**

**Job also includes a two bedroom apartment that the company will cover costs of rent, gas, and power.**

- Two years’ experience in building maintenance and repairs.

- One year experience in supervision of building personnel and services is preferable.

- Ability to obtain technical licenses required by the City of New York within the first twelve months of employment. (S-95)

**Physical Requirements & Work Environment**

Given the nature of the position, the individual must be able to safely work in areas such as construction zones, machine and boiler rooms, rooms, or closets where access to mechanical, electric, and communication panels are located, water and sewage pumps, elevator access rooms, maintenance and facilities equipment and other items and supplies are stored, HVAC units, any fuel sources, roofs, and ceilings in buildings, etc. In addition, the work environment may be subject to variable work temperatures, environmental elements (ie. snow, rain, sleet, etc.), and other environmental factors unregulated and/or unknown at this time but may be encountered due to the nature of the position.

Individuals must be able to sustain certain physical requirements essential to the job. This includes, but is not limited to:

* **Standing** – Duration of up to 8 hours a day.
* **Sitting/Stationary positions** – Sedentary position in duration of up to 6-8 hours a day for consecutive hours/periods.
* **Lifting/Push/Pull** – Up to 75 pounds of equipment, baggage, supplies, and other items used in the scope of the job using OSHA guidelines, etc.
* **Bending/Squatting** – Must be able to safely bend or squat to perform the essential functions under the scope of the job for extended periods during the workday.
* **Stairs/Steps/Walking/Climbing** – Must be able to safely maneuver and work on stairs, ladders, scaffolds, etc. climb up/down and walk to access work areas. Must be able to climb and crawl into spaces and work areas. The position requires the individual to be able to travel and walk between sites/locations and work areas throughout the day.
* **Agility/Fine Motor Skills** - Must demonstrate agility and fine motor skills to operate and activate equipment, devices, instruments, and tools to complete essential job functions (ie. typing, use of supplies, equipment, tools, switches, dials, etc.)
* **Sight/Visual Requirements** – Must be able to visually assess and evaluate the physical environment from floor to ceiling during environmental rounds, read documentation, papers, orders, signs, etc., and type/write documentation, etc. with accuracy. Required to wear eye protection for some tasks.
* **Audio Hearing and Motor Skills (language) Requirements** – Must be able to listen attentively and document information from patients, community members, co-workers, clients, providers, etc., and intake information through audio processing with accuracy. In addition, must be able to speak comfortably and clearly with language and motor skills for customers to understand the individual. In addition, must use audio processing to conduct environmental rounds for alarms, bells, etc.
* **Cognitive Ability** – Must be able to demonstrate good decision-making, reasonableness, cognitive ability, rational processing, and analysis to satisfy essential functions of the job.

**Disclaimer:** Responsibilities and tasks outlined in this job description are not exhaustive and may change as determined by the needs of the company.

We are an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, height, weight, or genetic information. We are committed to providing access, equal opportunity, and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities.

title: Shul Administrator (Part-Time/Hourly)
description:
We are seeking a Part-Time, hourly skilled Shul Administrator. This is an hourly position that is mostly remote, but may require occasional in-person work at the Shul, which is located on the Lower East Side of Manhattan. The ideal candidate has experience in customer service, communications (specifically email and social media), event planning, and administration/operations. Experience with the ShulCloud platform is a plus, as is past experience working at a synagogue or other Jewish institution.

To apply, kindly send a resume and cover letter to Brina at info@stantonstshul.com. The full job description can be found here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xgbfVKgSH89vhPhngSLO4WhSDuXoZh8W/view

**Communications**

● Prepare & distribute weekly newsletter, referencing community announcements, Rabbi’s

weekly column, calendar of events, etc.

● Manage Shul’s email account & email communication with members

● Distribute all mass emails, including upcoming holiday & event announcements, and

targeted emails for specific email lists such as Womens’ Tefillah Group & StantonKIDS

● Maintain up-to-date website & Shul calendar, including life cycle events such as

Yahrtzeits, birthdays, anniversaries, etc.

● Manage Shul Zoom account, including monthly virtual Board meetings, and update

Youtube channel

● Create and distribute promotional materials via email and social media for events

**Event Planning**

● Organize Kiddush logistics (planning menu and ordering food, coordinating delivery,

staffing for prep + cleaning, etc.) on a weekly basis for Shabbat day, as well as for all

relevant Jewish holidays, community dinners, and special Shul events

● Organize logistics for annual Shul Benefit

**Donations**

● Manage and enter donations into ShulCloud and keep ShulCloud database up-to-date

● Follow up on donations with members and track donations for specific annual campaigns

● Prepare and distribute tax letters for all eligible donors on an annual basis

**Membership**

● Facilitate annual membership drive by preparing invoices and tracking new

memberships & membership renewals

**Produce Annual Bulletin**

● Coordinate with graphic designer and Shul congregants to edit, produce and distribute

annual bulletin (both print and electronic versions), featuring articles written by officers

and members, photos from events, event calendar for the upcoming year and schedule

for High Holidays

**Miscellaneous**

● Manage access to building space, including for outside groups

● Manage issues with appliances in the building space on an as-needed basis

● Other tasks, as-needed

Pay: $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 4 – 7 per week

* Flexible schedule

* Choose your own hours

title: HSPD-12: Government Badging & Credentialing Specialist (Springfield - REF1669T)
description:
**Company Description**  

Citizant is a leading provider of professional IT services to the U.S. government. We seek to address some of our country’s most pressing challenges in the areas of Agile application development, Enterprise Data Management, Enterprise Architecture, and Program Management support services – focusing on the U.S. Departments of Homeland Security and Treasury. We strive to hire only ethical, talented, passionate, and committed “A Players” who already align with the company’s core values: Drive, Excellence, Reputation, Responsibility, and a Better Future. No matter how large we grow, Citizant will retain its collaborative, supportive, small-company culture, where successful team effort to address external and internal customer challenges is valued above all individual contributions.

 **Job Description** **Salary Range:** **$37,800 - $51,400 (depending on experience).**

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

**Enrollment Process Management:**

* Schedule appointments and/or service walk-ins for Personal Identity Verification (PIV) Card Activations, Enrollments, Certificate Updates and PIN Resets.
* Answering phone calls/email inquiries for all things related to PIV credentials and access control matters.
* Coordinate and conduct the enrollment process for PIV cards, including verifying the identity of applicants and collecting required documentation.
* Manage appointments and schedules to accommodate a steady flow of applicants while maintaining efficiency and accuracy.

**Documentation and Data Collection:**

* Accurately collect and document personal information, biometric data (such as fingerprints), and other necessary details from applicants.
* Ensure that all required documents and forms are properly completed and submitted according to established guidelines.

**Verification and Authentication:**

* Verify the authenticity of provided documents and information to prevent fraudulent enrollment attempts.
* Use approved verification methods to ensure the identity of applicants before proceeding with the enrollment process.

**Data Security and Privacy:**

* Handle sensitive personal information with the utmost discretion and adhere to data protection regulations and organizational security protocols.
* Maintain the security and integrity of collected data and prevent unauthorized access or disclosure.

**Communication:**

* Communicate clearly and professionally with applicants, explaining the enrollment process, required documents, and any additional steps they need to follow.
* Provide excellent customer service to address questions and concerns related to the enrollment process.
* Escalation management, as it involves listening, understanding, and responding to customer needs and expectations.
* De-escalated problematic customer concerns, maintaining calm, friendly demeanor.

**Recordkeeping:**

* Maintain accurate records of the enrollment process, including documentation of each applicant's information, enrollment date, and any issues encountered.
* Prepare and maintain spreadsheets tracking status of new applicant, contractor, and federal employee files.

**Compliance and Training:**

* Stay up to date with relevant policies, regulations, and procedures related to PIV card enrollment.
* Participate in training sessions to enhance knowledge of enrollment processes, data security practices, and customer service skills.

  

**Qualifications** **Required Competencies:**

* Experience with Microsoft Excel for data management, coordination, and reporting.
* Ability to adapt to changing security procedures and requirements.
* Prior experience in a similar role, customer service, or administrative position may be advantageous.
* Attention to detail and strong organizational skills.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
* Ability to handle confidential information with discretion.
* Perform other job-related duties as assigned.

**Physical Requirements:**

* The role primarily involves sedentary work.
* There may be occasional instances of stair climbing.
* Periodic standing and/or walking for extended durations may be required.
* Occasional activities such as reaching, squatting, bending, pulling, grasping, holding, and lifting objects weighing 25 - 30 lbs.
* Requires typing for most of the day.
* Effective communication through frequent periods of talking and listening is essential.

**Education:**

* High School diploma, GED certification

**Clearance Requirement:**

* US Citizenship required.
* Active Public Trust/MBI clearance or the ability to obtain one.

  

**Additional Information**  

Citizant strives to be an employer of choice in the Washington metropolitan area. Citizant associates accept challenging and rewarding work and in return receive excellent compensation and benefits, as well as the opportunity for personal and professional development.  

  

Citizant is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

title: Trader, Discretionary Investments
description:
Job description
Our purpose – Opening up a world of opportunity – explains why we exist. Here at HSBC we use our unique expertise, capabilities, breadth and perspectives to open up new kinds of opportunity for our more than 40 million customers. We’re bringing together the people, ideas and capital that nurture progress and growth, helping to create a better world – for our customers, our people, our investors, our communities and the planet we all share.  

  

The Trader, Discretionary Investments is instrumental to the efficient operation and Trading of Fixed Income and Equity Securities for Private Banking Discretionary portfolios. Control and monitor the activities to remain compliant on an ongoing basis whilst keeping in mind all the risk factors related to the role purpose. Polyvalent to actively interact with both internal (PM) and external (RM & IC) clients.  

  

As our Trader, Discretionary Investments you will:


* Ensure proper and cost effective execution of trades
* Execute trades generated by the Portfolio Managers
* Maintain strong relationships with broker dealers on the street, and actively communicate with the PMs about the daily market movements and trends
* Communicate with the PMs about the daily market movements and trends
  

For this role, HSBC targets a pay range between $155,700.00 and $233,600.00

  

The final fixed pay offer will depend on the candidate and a number of variables, including but not limited to, role responsibilities, skill set, depth of experience and education, licensing/certification requirements, internal relativity, and specific work location.  

  

At HSBC, our overall goal is to provide a competitive Total Reward Package, with an appropriate mix of fixed pay, and variable pay, as part of an employee’s overall total compensation and benefits. Variable pay generally takes the form of discretionary, annual awards (sometimes referred to as a “bonus”). Additionally, HSBC offers a wide range of competitive and flexible benefits designed to help you improve your health and well-being, finances, and lifestyle.


Requirements
You´ll likely have the following qualifications to succeed in this role:

  

* Minimum 3 years’ experience as Financial Market Trader
* Strong understanding of Equity and Fixed Income Markets
* Knowledge of Bloomberg, Market Access, Moxy would be preferred
* Bachelor’s Degree
* Graduate degree and/or CFA candidate, preferred
  

In compliance with applicable laws, HSBC is committed to employing only those who are authorized to work in the U.S. Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. as HSBC will not engage in immigration sponsorship for this position.  

  

As an HSBC employee, you will have access to tailored professional development opportunities to ensure you have the right skills for today and tomorrow. We offer a competitive pay and benefits package including a robust Wellness Hub, all in a welcoming, diverse and inclusive work environment. You will be empowered to drive HSBC’s engagement with the communities we serve through an industry-leading volunteerism policy, a generous matching gift program, and a comprehensive program of immersive Sustainability and Climate Change Initiatives. You’ll want to join our Employee Resource Groups as they play a central part in life at HSBC, including the development of our employees and networking inside and outside of HSBC. We value difference. We succeed together. We take responsibility. We get it done. And we want you to help us build the bank of the future!  

  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, race, national origin, ethnicity, disability or medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran service, religion, creed, sex, gender, pregnancy, childbirth, caregiver status, marital status, citizenship or immigration status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression or any other trait protected by applicable law.
company_description: HSBC is one of the world’s largest banking and financial services organisations. We serve more than 40 million customers across a network that covers 64 countries and territories.

title: Program Director - Individual Assistance
description:
**SPAN Parent Advocacy Network -** ***Empowered Families: Educated, Engaged, Effective!***

Are you interested in supporting a non-profit group seeking to provide families of children with and without disabilities in the education system?

The SPAN Parent Advocacy Network is a nonprofit organization whose mission is to empower families and inform and involve professionals and others interested in the healthy development of children in New Jersey and throughout the country. SPAN is funded through private contributions and grants from government, foundations, and corporations.

SPAN is seeking a skilled and experienced **full-time Program Director** for our individual assistance program. The individual assistance Program Director manages a talented team of Family Resource Specialists, who work to enhance the involvement of empowered and educated parents and caregivers in improving academic and health outcomes for children in New Jersey.

The Program Director position is a full-time, salaried, exempt position at 37.5 hours per week. This is a hybrid position, with three or more days per week in our Newark office. This position may require Saturday and Sunday hours to support SPAN events and conferences. The Project Coordinator is also expected to attend quarterly meetings of SPAN staff, as well as various state and national training conferences. All SPAN staff are also required to complete SPAN’s Resource Parent (SRP) training program within one year after date of hire.

**Key Job Responsibilities**

* Oversee all aspects of SPAN individual assistance program activities, consistent with responsibilities and deliverables under federal and state grants and contracts
* Supervise the work of family resource specialists, who provide timely, accurate and effective individual assistance to parents of children with special needs and other stakeholders, to ensure that all project responsibilities are met or exceeded
* Utilize the Salesforce content management system to coordinate data collection, analyze data for trends, manage the process for reporting data to funding agencies, and use data to develop resources and tools for families
* Ensure that individual assistance is provided in a timely manner by reviewing Salesforce data on a regular basis and acting to improve response time for callers to the SPAN Warmline
* Other duties as assigned

**Qualifications**

* Understanding and support of the mission and vision of SPAN and the role of the individual assistance program within SPAN
* Thorough knowledge of federal and state laws, regulations, and rules regarding the provision of special education, early intervention, and other services provided to students with disabilities throughout New Jersey, including laws affecting the civil rights of students
* Thorough knowledge of resources and programs available to assist parents and caregivers of students with disabilities
* Experience in supervising program staff
* Outstanding leadership in the areas of program management and professional development
* Knowledge and experience of contact management systems such as Salesforce preferred

**Job Requirements**

* Experience in a leadership role within the non-profit or educational sector, ideally with a concentration on disability issues preferred
* In-depth understanding of the needs of parents in the special and general education system
* Experience interacting with diverse populations; bilingual candidates a plus
* Experience with computers and knowledge of Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, database software, and internet is essential
* Ability to work flexible hours
* Capacity to exercise independent judgment and sound decision-making
* Demonstrated commitment to the goals of the project and organization

www.spanadvocacy.org

Job Type: Full-time

* 403(b)
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance

* Professional development assistance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed
